52.5: But God will destroy you forever. He will pick you up and pull you away from your tent. He will pull up your roots from the land of the living.
52.6: And those who are right will see and be afraid. They will laugh at him, saying,
52.7: “Look, the man who would not make God his safe place, but trusted in his many riches and was strong in his sinful desire.”
52.8: But I am like a green olive tree in the house of God. I trust in the loving-kindness of God forever and ever.
52.9: I will give You thanks forever because of what You have done. And I will hope in Your name, for it is good to be where those who belong to You are.

53.1: The fool has said in his heart, “There is no God.” They are sinful and have done bad things. There is no one who does good.
53.2: God has looked down from heaven at the children of men to see if there is anyone who understands and looks for God.
53.3: They have all turned back. They have all turned to sin. There is no one who does good, not even one.
53.4: Have those who do wrong no understanding? They eat up My people like they eat bread. They have not called upon God.
53.5: There they were, in much fear, where there was nothing to be afraid of. For God has spread out the bones of those who come against you. You put them to shame, because God has turned away from them.
53.6: O, that the saving of Israel would come out of Zion! Jacob will be full of joy and Israel will be glad when God returns His people to their land.

54.1: Save me by Your name, O God. And stand with me by Your power.
54.2: Hear my prayer, O God. Listen to the words of my mouth.
54.3: For strangers have risen against me. And men who hurt others want to take my life. They do not think about God.
54.4: See, God is my Helper. The Lord is the One Who keeps my soul alive.
54.5: He will punish those who hate me, for the wrong they have done. He will destroy them because He is faithful.
54.6: I will be glad to give You a gift on the altar. I will give thanks to Your name, O Lord, for it is good.
54.7: For He has taken me out of all trouble. And my eyes have looked without fear upon those who hate me.

55.1: Listen to my prayer, O God. Do not hide Yourself from what I ask.
55.2: Hear me and answer me. My thoughts trouble me and I have no peace,
55.3: because of the voice of those who hate me and the power of the sinful. For they bring trouble upon me, and in anger they keep on having bad thoughts against me.
55.4: My heart is in pain within me. The fears of death have come upon me.
55.5: I have begun shaking with fear. Fear has power over me.
55.6: And I say, “If only I had wings like a dove, I would fly away and be at rest.
55.7: Yes, I would go far away. I would live in the desert.
55.8: I would hurry to my safe place, away from the wild wind and storm.”
55.9: Mix them up, O Lord. Divide their tongues. For I have seen fighting and trouble in the city.
55.10: They go around on its walls day and night. Sin and wrong-doing are within it.
55.11: Destroying powers are in the city. Trouble and lies never leave its streets.
55.12: I would be able to take it if one who hates me were putting me to shame. I could hide from him. It is not one who hates me who has put himself up against me.
55.13: But it is you, a man like myself, one who has gone with me, my close friend.
55.14: We shared together. And we walked with the people in the house of God.
55.15: Let death take them by surprise. Let them go down alive to the grave. For sin is with them where they live.
55.16: As for me, I will call on God and the Lord will save me.
55.17: I will cry out and complain in the evening and morning and noon, and He will hear my voice.
55.18: He will save my soul in peace from those who make war against me. For there are many who fight me.
55.19: God sits on His throne forever. And He will hear them and bring trouble upon them, because there has been no change in them. They do not fear God.
55.20: He goes against those who were at peace with him. He has broken his agreement.
55.21: What he says is smoother than butter, but war is in his heart. His words are softer than oil, yet they are raised swords.
55.22: Give all your cares to the Lord and He will give you strength. He will never let those who are right with Him be shaken.
55.23: But You, O God, will bring the sinful down into the hole that destroys. Men who kill and lie will not live out half their days. But I will trust in You.

56.1: Show me Your loving-kindness, O God, for man has walked on me. All day long the one who tries to keep me down fights with me.
56.2: All day long those who hate me have walked on me. For there are many who fight against me with pride.
56.3: When I am afraid, I will trust in You.
56.4: I praise the Word of God. I have put my trust in God. I will not be afraid. What can only a man do to me?
56.5: All day long they change my words to say what I did not say. They are always thinking of ways to hurt me.
56.6: They go after me as in a fight. They hide themselves. They watch my steps, as they have waited to take my life.
56.7: Because they are bad, do not let them get away. Bring down the people in Your anger, O God.
56.8: You have seen how many places I have gone. Put my tears in Your bottle. Are they not in Your book?
56.9: Then those who hate me will turn back when I call. I know that God is for me.
56.10: I praise the Word of God. I praise the Word of the Lord.
56.11: In God I have put my trust. I will not be afraid. What can man do to me?
56.12: I am under an agreement with You, O God. I will give You gifts of thanks.
56.13: For You have set my soul free from death. You have kept my feet from falling, so I may walk with God in the light of life.

57.1: Show me loving-kindness, O God, show me loving-kindness. For my soul goes to You to be safe. And I will be safe in the shadow of Your wings until the trouble has passed.
57.2: I will cry to God Most High, to God Who finishes all things for me.
57.3: He will send from heaven and save me. He will put to shame him who is breaking me under his feet. God will send His loving-kindness and His truth.
57.4: My soul is among lions. I must lie among the sons of men who breathe fire, whose teeth are spears and arrows, and whose tongues are a sharp sword.
57.5: Be lifted up above the heavens, O God. Let Your shining-greatness be above all the earth.
57.6: They have set a net for my steps. My soul is brought down. They dug a deep hole in front of me. But they themselves have fallen into it.
57.7: My heart will not be moved, O God. My heart cannot be moved. I will sing, yes, I will sing praises!
57.8: Awake, my shining-greatness. Awake, harps. I will awake early in the morning.
57.9: O Lord, I will give thanks to You among the people. I will sing praises to You among the nations.
57.10: For Your loving-kindness is great to the heavens, and Your truth to the clouds.
57.11: Be lifted up above the heavens, O God. Let Your shining-greatness be above all the earth.

58.1: Do you speak what is right and good, O you powerful ones? Are you always right in how you judge, O sons of men?
58.2: No, in your heart you do what is wrong. You use your hands to hurt and destroy in the land.
58.3: The sinful go wrong as soon as they are born. Those who speak lies go the wrong way from birth.
58.4: Their poison is like the poison of a snake. They are like a cobra that cannot or will not listen.
58.5: It does not hear the voice of the man who has power over it, even if the man is very good in his work.
58.6: O God, break the teeth in their mouth. Break out the teeth of the young lions, O Lord.
58.7: Let them flow away like water that pours. When he uses his arrows, let them have no heads.
58.8: Let them be like a snail that melts away as it goes. Like a baby born dead, may they never see the sun.
58.9: Before your pots can feel the fire of thorns, He will blow them away with a storm, both the green and the burning ones.
58.10: The one who is right and good will be full of joy when he sees the sinful punished. He will wash his feet in their blood.
58.11: And men will say, “For sure there is pay for those who are right and good. For sure there is a God Who says who is guilty or not on the earth.”

59.1: O my God, take me away from those who hate me. Put me up high above those who rise up against me.
59.2: Take me away from those who do wrong. And save me from those who kill.
59.3: For, look, they lie in wait for my life. Strong men are gathering together to fight me, but not because of my wrong-doing or my sin, O Lord.
59.4: I have done no wrong, but they get ready to fight against me. Rise up to help me.
59.5: You, O Lord God of All, God of Israel, rise up to punish all the nations. Show no loving-kindness to those people who cannot be trusted and plan sins.
59.6: They return at evening. They sound like dogs and go around the city.
59.7: See, they spit with their mouth. Swords are in their lips. And they say, “Who can hear us?”
59.8: But You laugh at them, O Lord. You laugh at all the nations.
59.9: O my Strength, I will watch for You. For God is my strong place.
59.10: My God in His loving-kindness will meet me. God will let me look at those who come against me and know that I will win the fight.
59.11: Do not kill them, or my people may forget. Divide them by Your power and bring them down, O Lord, our safe-covering.
59.12: Let them be caught in their pride for the sin of their mouth and the words of their lips. For the lies and bad things they say,
59.13: destroy them in anger. Destroy them so that they will be no more. Let it be known that God rules in Jacob and to the ends of the earth.
59.14: They return at evening. They make sounds like dogs and go around the city.
59.15: They go around looking for food and they show their teeth if they are not filled.
59.16: But as for me, I will sing of Your strength. Yes, I will sing with joy of Your loving-kindness in the morning. For You have been a strong and safe place for me in times of trouble.
59.17: O my Strength, I will sing praises to You. For God is my strong place and the God Who shows me loving-kindness.

60.1: O God, You have turned away from us. You have broken us. You have been angry. O heal us and turn to us again.
60.2: You have made the land shake. You have torn it open. Heal it where it is broken, for it shakes.
60.3: You have made Your people suffer hard things. You have given us wine to drink that makes us not able to walk straight.
60.4: You have given a flag to those who fear You, so it may be seen because of the truth.
60.5: Save us with Your right hand, and answer us, so Your loved ones may be set free.
60.6: God has said in His holy place: “I will be full of joy. I will divide Shechem and the valley of Succoth.
60.7: Gilead is Mine. And Manasseh is Mine. Ephraim is the covering for My head. Judah is My Law giver.
60.8: Moab is where I wash My hands. I will throw My shoe over Edom. Call out, Philistia, because of me.”
60.9: Who will bring me into the strong city? Who will lead me into Edom?
60.10: Have You not turned away from us, O God? And will You not go out with our armies, O God?
60.11: O give us help against those who hate us. For the help of man is worth nothing.
60.12: With God’s help we will do well. And He will break under His feet those who fight against us.

61.1: Hear my cry, O God. Listen to my prayer.
61.2: I call to You from the end of the earth when my heart is weak. Lead me to the rock that is higher than I.
61.3: For You have been a safe place for me, a tower of strength where I am safe from those who fight against me.
61.4: Let me live in Your tent forever. Let me be safe under the covering of Your wings.
61.5: For You have heard my promises, O God. You have given me that which You give to those who fear Your name.
61.6: You will add days to the life of the king. His years will be as long as the lives of many children and grandchildren added together.
61.7: He will stay forever with God. Set apart loving-kindness and truth to keep him safe.
61.8: So I will sing thanks to Your name forever and keep my promises day by day.

62.1: My soul is quiet and waits for God alone. He is the One Who saves me.
62.2: He alone is my rock and the One Who saves me. He is my strong place. I will not be shaken.
62.3: How long will all of you go against a man to break him down, that you may kill him, like a wall that no longer stands straight, like a fence ready to fall?
62.4: They have talked only about throwing him down from his high place. They find joy in lies. They pray with their mouth that good will come. But inside they hope that bad will come instead.
62.5: My soul is quiet and waits for God alone. My hope comes from Him.
62.6: He alone is my rock and the One Who saves me. He is my strong place. I will not be shaken.
62.7: My being safe and my honor rest with God. My safe place is in God, the rock of my strength.
62.8: Trust in Him at all times, O people. Pour out your heart before Him. God is a safe place for us.
62.9: Men who are not important come to nothing. Men who are important are a lie. When weighed they go up. Together they weigh less than a breath.
62.10: Do not get money in a wrong way or be proud in stolen things. If you get more riches, do not set your heart on them.
62.11: God has spoken once. I have heard this twice: Power belongs to God.
62.12: And loving-kindness belongs to You, O Lord. For You pay every man by the work he has done.

63.1: O God, You are my God. I will look for You with all my heart and strength. My soul is thirsty for You. My flesh is weak wanting You in a dry and tired land where there is no water.
63.2: So I have seen You in the holy place. And I have seen Your power and Your shining-greatness.
63.3: My lips will praise You because Your loving-kindness is better than life.
63.4: So I will give honor to You as long as I live. I will lift up my hands in Your name.
63.5: My soul will be filled as with rich foods. And my mouth praises You with lips of joy.
63.6: On my bed I remember You. I think of You through the hours of the night.
63.7: For You have been my help. And I sing for joy in the shadow of Your wings.
63.8: My soul holds on to You. Your right hand holds me up.
63.9: But those who want to take my life and destroy it will go deep into the earth.
63.10: They will be given over to the power of the sword. They will become food for foxes.
63.11: But the king will be full of joy in God. All who are faithful to God will be full of joy. For the mouth of those who speak lies will be stopped.

64.1: O God, hear my voice when I complain. Keep my life safe from the fear of those who hate me.
64.2: Hide me from the secret plans of the sinful and from the noise of those who do bad things.
64.3: They have made their tongues sharp like a sword. They use poison words like arrows.
64.4: They shoot at the man without blame from their hiding place. They are quick to shoot at him and are not afraid.
64.5: They talk each other into doing sinful things. They talk about setting hidden traps. They say, “Who will see them?”
64.6: They think of ways to do bad things, and say, “We have made a perfect plan!” For the inside thoughts and the heart of a man are deep.
64.7: But God will shoot at them with an arrow. They will be hurt very soon.
64.8: They will be made to trip and fall. Their own tongue is against them. All who see them will shake their heads.
64.9: Then all men will be afraid. They will tell about the work of God. And they will think about what He has done.
64.10: The man who is right and good will be glad in the Lord and go to Him to be safe. All those whose hearts are right will give Him praise.

65.1: All will be quiet before You, and praise belongs to You, O God, in Zion. And our promise to You will be kept.
65.2: O You Who hears prayer, to You all men come.
65.3: My sins are strong against me. But You forgive our sins.
65.4: Happy is the man You choose and bring near to You to live in Your holy place. We will be filled with the good things of Your house, Your holy house.
65.5: O God Who saves us, You answer us in the way that is right and good by Your great works that make people stand in fear. You are the hope of all the ends of the earth and of the farthest seas.
65.6: You have built the mountains by Your strength. You are dressed with power.
65.7: You quiet the storm of the seas, the sound of their waves, and the noise of the people.
65.8: Those who live far away are afraid of Your great works. You make morning and evening call out for joy.
65.9: You visit the earth and water it. You make it very rich. The river of God is full of water. You give the people grain when You have made the earth ready.
65.10: You water where the plow has been used. You cover the seeds with earth. You make it soft with rain. And You make the plants grow well.
65.11: You crown the year with Your good gifts. There is more than enough where You have been.
65.12: The fields of the desert are filled with water. And the hills dress themselves with joy.
65.13: The grass lands are covered with birds. And the valleys are covered with grain. They call out for joy and sing.

66.1: Raise the voice of joy to God, all the earth!
66.2: Sing out the honor of His name! Make His praise great!
66.3: Say to God, “How Your great works make those who hate You afraid! They will have to obey You because of Your great power.
66.4: All the earth will worship You and sing praises to You. They will sing praises to Your name.”
66.5: Come and see what God has done. There is much fear because of His great works toward the children of men.
66.6: He changed the sea into dry land. They passed through the river on foot. There we were full of joy in Him.
66.7: He rules forever by His power. His eyes keep watch over the nations. Do not let those who do not obey You honor themselves.
66.8: Give honor and thanks to God, O people, and let all hear how great He is!
66.9: He keeps us alive, and does not let our feet go out from under us.
66.10: For You have tested us, O God. You have made us pure like silver is made pure.
66.11: You brought us into the net. And You laid a heavy load on our back.
66.12: You made men travel over our heads. We went through fire and through water. But You brought us out into a place where we have much more than we need.
66.13: I will come into Your house with burnt gifts. I will give You what I promised,
66.14: promises made by my lips and spoken by my mouth when I was in trouble.
66.15: I will give You burnt gifts of fat animals with the smoke of rams. I will give You bulls with male goats.
66.16: Come and hear, all who fear God, and I will tell you what He has done for me.
66.17: I cried to Him with my mouth and praised Him with my tongue.
66.18: The Lord will not hear me if I hold on to sin in my heart.
66.19: But it is sure that God has heard. He has listened to the voice of my prayer.
66.20: Honor and thanks be to God! He has not turned away from my prayer or held His loving-kindness from me.

67.1: May God show loving-kindness toward us and bring good to us. May He make His face shine upon us.
67.2: May Your way be known on the earth, and Your saving power among all nations.
67.3: May the people praise You, O God. May all the people praise You.
67.4: May the nations be glad and sing for joy. For You will be fair when You judge the people and rule the nations of the earth.
67.5: May the people praise You, O God. May all the people praise You.
67.6: The earth has given its fruit. God, our God, will bring good to us.
67.7: God will bring good to us, and all the ends of the earth will fear Him.

68.1: May God rise up. May those who hate Him be divided. And may they run away from Him.
68.2: Drive them away like smoke in the wind. Let the sinful be destroyed before God like a candle melts by the fire.
68.3: But let those who are right and good be glad. Let them be happy before God. Yes, let them be full of joy.
68.4: Sing to God. Sing praises to His name. Make a road for Him Who goes through the deserts. The Lord is His name. Be full of joy before Him.
68.5: God in His holy house is a father to those who have no father. And He keeps the women safe whose husbands have died.
68.6: God makes a home for those who are alone. He leads men out of prison into happiness and well-being. But those who fight against Him live in an empty desert.
68.7: O God, when You went out before Your people, when You walked through the desert,
68.8: the earth shook. The heavens poured down rain before God. And Sinai shook before God, the God of Israel.
68.9: You sent a heavy rain, O God. You brought life back to Your promised land when it was dry.
68.10: Your people made it their home. O God, You gave the poor what they needed because You are good.
68.11: The Lord gives the Word. And the women who tell the good news are many.
68.12: The kings of armies run. They run away. And she who stays at home divides the riches.
68.13: When you lie down among the sheep, you are like the wings of a dove covered with silver, and the end of its wings with shining gold.
68.14: When the All-powerful divided the kings there, snow was falling in Zalmon.
68.15: A mountain of God is the mountain of Bashan. A mountain of many high tops is the mountain of Bashan.
68.16: O mountains of many high tops, why do you look with jealousy at the mountain which God has chosen for His home? For sure, the Lord will live there forever.
68.17: The war-wagons of God are 20,000, even thousands of thousands. The Lord is among them, as at Sinai, in the holy place.
68.18: You have gone up on high. You have taken those who were held with You. You have received gifts of men, even among those who fought against You. So the Lord God may live there with them.
68.19: Honor and thanks be to the Lord, Who carries our heavy loads day by day. He is the God Who saves us.
68.20: Our God is a God Who sets us free. The way out of death belongs to God the Lord.
68.21: But God will break the head of those who hate Him, the hair-covered head of him who goes on in his sins.
68.22: The Lord said, “I will bring them back from Bashan. I will bring them back from the bottom of the sea.
68.23: So your feet may crush them in blood. And the tongue of your dogs may have a share of those who hate you.”
68.24: They have seen Your people walking together, O God. They have seen the people of my God and King walking into the holy place.
68.25: Those who sing are in front. Those who play music are behind. And young women who beat timbrels are between.
68.26: Give thanks to God in the meetings of worship. Give thanks to the Lord, you who are of the family of Israel.
68.27: There is young Benjamin leading them. The rulers of Judah are among the people, and the rulers of Zebulun, and the rulers of Naphtali.
68.28: Your God has called for your strength. Show Your strength, O God, Who has acted for us.
68.29: Kings will bring gifts to You because of Your holy house at Jerusalem.
68.30: Speak sharp words to the wild animals in the tall grass by the river, the group of bulls with the calves of the people. Walk on those who desire pieces of silver. Divide the people who have joy in war.
68.31: Princes will come from Egypt. Ethiopia will hurry to put her hands out to God.
68.32: Sing to God, O nations of the earth. Sing praises to the Lord.
68.33: Sing to Him Who sits upon the heavens, the heavens of old. Listen, He sends out His voice, His powerful voice.
68.34: Tell of the power of God. His great power is over Israel and His strength is in the sky.
68.35: O God, You are honored with fear as You come from Your holy place. The God of Israel Himself gives strength and power to His people. Honor and thanks be to God!

69.1: Save me, O God, for the waters have almost taken my life.
69.2: I have gone down into deep mud and there is no place to put my feet. I have come into deep waters and a flood comes over me.
69.3: I have cried until I am tired. My mouth is dry. My eyes become weak while I wait for my God.
69.4: Those who hate me, without a reason, are more than the hairs on my head. Those who want to destroy me are powerful. I am made to return things that I did not steal.
69.5: O God, You know how foolish I am. My sins are not hidden from You.
69.6: May those who wait for You not be put to shame because of me, O Lord God of All. May those who look for You not lose respect because of me, O God of Israel.
69.7: I have been put to shame because of You. Shame has covered my face.
69.8: I have become a stranger to my brothers, a stranger to my mother’s sons.
69.9: For the strong desire for Your house has burned me up. And the bad things said about You have fallen on me.
69.10: When I cried and went without food, I was put to shame.
69.11: When I put on clothes made from hair, they made fun of me.
69.12: Those who sit by the gate talk about me. And I am the song of those who drink too much.
69.13: But as for me, my prayer is to You at the right time, O Lord. Answer me with Your saving truth in Your great loving-kindness, O God.
69.14: Take me out of the mud and do not let me go down in it. Take me away from those who hate me and from the deep waters.
69.15: Keep the flood water from covering me. Do not let the sea swallow me up. Do not let the deep hole close its mouth over me.
69.16: Answer me, O Lord, for Your loving-kindness is good. Turn to me because of Your great loving-pity.
69.17: Do not hide Your face from Your servant, for I am in trouble. Hurry to answer me.
69.18: Come near to me and save me. Pay the price to set me free from those who hate me.
69.19: You know how I have been put to shame by the bad things said about me. All those who hate me are before You.
69.20: Being put to shame has broken my heart, and I feel very sick. I looked for pity but there was none. I looked for someone to comfort me but there was no one.
69.21: They gave me bitter drink in my food. And because I was thirsty they gave me sour wine.
69.22: May their table in front of them become a net. May it become a trap when they are in peace.
69.23: May their eyes grow dark so they cannot see. And may their backs always shake.
69.24: Pour out Your anger on them. May Your burning anger catch up with them.
69.25: May their place of living be empty and may no one live in their tents.
69.26: For they have made it hard for the one You have punished. And they talk about the pain of those You have hurt.
69.27: Let their sins add up, and may they not become right with You.
69.28: May they be taken out of the book of life, and not be written down with those who are right with You.
69.29: But I am suffering and in pain. O God, may You save me and set me up on high.
69.30: I will praise the name of God with song. And I will give Him great honor with much thanks.
69.31: This will please the Lord more than any ox or young bull with horns and hoofs.
69.32: Those without pride will see it and be glad. You who look for God, let your heart receive new strength.
69.33: For the Lord hears those who are in need, and does not hate His people in prison.
69.34: Let heaven and earth and the seas and all the things that move in them give thanks to Him.
69.35: For God will save Zion and build the cities of Judah. Then His people may live there and have it for their own.
69.36: And the children of those who obey Him will have it given to them. Those who love His name will live there.

70.1: O God, hurry to take me out of trouble. O Lord, hurry to help me!
70.2: Let those who want to kill me be ashamed and brought low. Let those who want to hurt me be turned away in shame.
70.3: Let those who say, “O, O!” be turned back because of their shame.
70.4: Let all who look for You be full of joy and be glad in You. And let those who love Your saving power always say, “Let God be honored.”
70.5: But I am poor and in need. Hurry to me, O God! You are my help and the One Who takes me out of trouble. O Lord, do not wait.

71.1: I have a safe place in you, O Lord. Let me never be ashamed.
71.2: Because You are right and good, take me out of trouble. Turn Your ear to me and save me.
71.3: Be a rock to me where I live, where I may always come and where I will be safe. For You are my rock and my safe place.
71.4: O my God, take me from the hand of the sinful, from the hand of the wrong-doer and the man without pity.
71.5: For You are my hope, O Lord God. You are my trust since I was young.
71.6: You have kept me safe from birth. It was You Who watched over me from the day I was born. My praise is always of You.
71.7: I have become a wonder and surprise to many. For You are my strong safe place.
71.8: My mouth is filled with Your praise and with Your honor all day long.
71.9: Do not let me fall by the way when I am old. Do not leave me alone when my strength is gone.
71.10: For those who hate me talk against me. Those who want to kill make plans together.
71.11: They say, “God has turned away from him. Run and catch him, for there is no one to take him out of trouble.”
71.12: O God, do not be far from me! O my God, hurry to help me!
71.13: Let those who are against me be ashamed and destroyed. Let those who want to hurt me be without honor and covered with shame.
71.14: But as for me, I will always have hope and I will praise You more and more.
71.15: My mouth will tell about how right and good You are and about Your saving acts all day long. For there are more than I can know.
71.16: I will come in the strength of the Lord God. I will tell about how right and good You are, and You alone.
71.17: O God, You have taught me from when I was young. And I still tell about Your great works.
71.18: Even when I am old and my hair is turning white, O God, do not leave me alone. Let me tell about Your strength to all the people living now, and about Your power to all who are to come.
71.19: O God, You are right and good, as the heavens are high. You have done great things, O God. Who is like You?
71.20: You have shown me many troubles of all kinds. But You will make me strong again. And You will bring me up again from deep in the earth.
71.21: Add to my greatness, and turn to comfort me.
71.22: O my God, I will praise You with a harp. I will praise Your truth. I will sing praises to You with different kinds of harps, O Holy One of Israel.
71.23: My lips will call out for joy when I sing praises to You. You have set my soul free.
71.24: My tongue will tell about how right and good You are all day long. For those who want to hurt me are ashamed and troubled.

72.1: O God, make the king right in what he decides. Make the king’s son right with You.
72.2: May he be right when he decides who is right and who is wrong and may he be fair to the poor.
72.3: Let mountains and hills bring peace to the people through what is right and good.
72.4: May he stand by those who are poor, save the children of those in need, and destroy the bad power over them.
72.5: May all the children-to-come fear You as long as the sun and the moon last.
72.6: May He come down like rain upon the cut grass, like rain that waters the earth.
72.7: In His days may all go well with those who are right and good. And may there be much peace until the moon is no more.
72.8: May he also rule from sea to sea, and from the river to the ends of the earth.
72.9: Those who live in the desert will put their faces to the ground before Him. And those who hate Him will kiss the dust.
72.10: Let the kings of Tarshish and of the islands bring gifts. Let the kings of Sheba and Seba bring gifts.
72.11: Yes, let all kings fall down at His feet, and all nations serve Him.
72.12: For He will take out of trouble the one in need when he cries for help, and the poor man who has no one to help.
72.13: He will have loving-pity on the weak and those in need. He will save the lives of those in need.
72.14: He will take them from the bad power that is held over them and from being hurt. Their blood will be of much worth in His eyes.
72.15: He will live, and the gold of Sheba will be given to Him. Prayer will be given for Him all the time. Let them honor Him all day long.
72.16: May there be much grain in the land on top of the mountains. May its fruit grow like the trees of Lebanon. And may those of the city grow like the grass of the earth.
72.17: May His name last forever. May His name become bigger as long as the sun shines. And let men respect themselves through Him. Let all nations honor Him.
72.18: Honor and thanks be to the Lord God, the God of Israel, Who alone does great things.
72.19: And honor be to His great name forever. May the whole earth be filled with His shining-greatness. Let it be so.
72.20: The prayers of David, the son of Jesse, are ended.

73.1: For sure God is good to Israel, to those who are pure in heart.
73.2: But as for me, my feet came close to falling. My steps had almost tripped.
73.3: For I was jealous of the proud when I saw that all was going well with the sinful.
73.4: For they suffer no pain in their death, and their body is fat.
73.5: They do not have the troubles of other men or suffer like other men.
73.6: So they wear pride around their neck. Fighting covers them like a coat.
73.7: They are so fat that their eyes are pushed out. The crazy thoughts of their hearts run wild.
73.8: They laugh at the truth, and speak sinful things about making it hard for others. They speak from a high place.
73.9: They say bad things against heaven, and their tongue walks through the earth.
73.10: And so his people return to this place and drink water from a full cup.
73.11: They say, “How does God know? Is there much learning with the Most High?”
73.12: See, this is what the sinful are like. They always have it easy and their riches grow.
73.13: For no good reason I have kept my heart pure and have not sinned.
73.14: For I have suffered all day long. I have been punished every morning.
73.15: I would not have been true to Your children if I had spoken this way.
73.16: It was too hard for me when I tried to understand this,
73.17: until I went into the holy place of God. Then I understood their end.
73.18: For sure, You set the sinful in places where there is danger at every step. You throw them down to be destroyed.
73.19: How they are destroyed right away! They come to an end with much fear.
73.20: Like a dream when one wakes up, so You will hate what they look like when You rise up, O Lord.
73.21: My heart was troubled and I was hurt inside.
73.22: I was without reason and did not know better. I was like an animal before You.
73.23: Yet I am always with You. You hold me by my right hand.
73.24: You will lead me by telling me what I should do. And after this, You will bring me into shining-greatness.
73.25: Whom have I in heaven but You? I want nothing more on earth, but You.
73.26: My body and my heart may grow weak, but God is the strength of my heart and all I need forever.
73.27: For, see, those who are far from You will be lost from You forever. You have destroyed all those who are not faithful to You.
73.28: But as for me, it is good to be near God. I have made the Lord God my safe place. So I may tell of all the things You have done.

74.1: O God, why have You turned away from us forever? Why does Your anger burn against the sheep in Your fields?
74.2: Remember Your people that You bought a long time ago. You made them free to be the family of Your promise, and Mount Zion, where You have lived.
74.3: Turn Your steps toward this place that has been destroyed forever. Those who hate You have destroyed all that is in the holy place.
74.4: Those who hate You have called out in the center of Your meeting place. They have set up their flags to show that they have won.
74.5: They acted like men taking up axes against a group of trees.
74.6: All of its fine work has been broken with axes and sticks.
74.7: They have burned Your holy place to the dust. They have made dirty the house of Your name.
74.8: They said in their hearts, “Let us destroy all of these places!” They have burned all the meeting places where God was worshiped in the land.
74.9: We do not see any special things happening. There is no longer anyone who speaks for God. And none of us knows how long this will be.
74.10: O God, how long will those who hate You laugh at the truth? Will they speak against Your name forever?
74.11: Why do You take Your hand away, even Your right hand? Put it out and destroy them!
74.12: God is still my King from long ago. He does saving works upon the earth.
74.13: You divided the sea by Your power. You broke the heads of the large dragons in the waters.
74.14: You crushed the heads of the Leviathan. And You fed him to the animals of the desert.
74.15: It was You Who opened up the earth for water to flow out. And You dried up rivers that flow forever.
74.16: The day is Yours. And the night is Yours. You have set the light and the sun in their places.
74.17: You have divided all the lands and seas and nations of the earth. You have made summer and winter.
74.18: Remember how those who hate You have laughed at the truth, O Lord. Foolish people have spoken against Your name.
74.19: Do not give the life of Your dove over to the wild animal. Do not forget the lives of Your troubled people forever.
74.20: Think about Your agreement. For the dark places of the land are full of fighting.
74.21: Do not let those who suffer under a bad power return without honor. Let those who suffer and those who are in need praise Your name.
74.22: Rise up, O God. Stand up for Your rights. Remember how the foolish man speaks against You all day long.
74.23: Do not forget the voice of those who hate You, the noise that comes without stopping from those who rise against You.

75.1: We give thanks to You, O God. We give thanks that Your name is near. Men tell about the great things You have done.
75.2: You say, “When the right time has come, I will be right and fair in deciding who is guilty or not.
75.3: When the earth and all its people shake, it is I Who will hold it together.
75.4: I said to the proud, ‘Do not speak with pride.’ And I said to the sinful, ‘Do not lift up the horn.
75.5: Do not lift your horn up high. Do not speak in your pride.’”
75.6: For honor does not come from the east or the west or from the desert.
75.7: But God is the One Who decides. He puts down one and brings respect to another.
75.8: For there is a cup in the Lord’s hand. It is full of strong wine that is well mixed. He pours out from it, and all the sinful people of the earth must drink all of it.
75.9: But as for me, I will tell of it forever. I will sing praises to the God of Jacob.
75.10: He will cut off all the horns of the sinful. But the horns of those who are right with God will be lifted up.

76.1: God is known in Judah. His name is great in Israel.
76.2: His holy tent of worship is in Salem. He lives in Zion.
76.3: There He broke the burning arrows, the iron covering and the sword, and all the things used for fighting in war.
76.4: You are shining with greatness, more beautiful than the mountains with many animals.
76.5: Strong men have been robbed. They sleep their last sleep. Not one of the soldiers can lift his hands.
76.6: O God of Jacob, both soldier and horse were put in a dead sleep because of Your sharp words.
76.7: You alone are to be feared. Who may stand before You when You are angry?
76.8: You said from heaven who is guilty or not. The earth was afraid and quiet
76.9: when God stood up to say who is guilty or not, and to save all the people of the earth who are not proud.
76.10: For the anger of man will praise You. And You will keep what is left of anger around You.
76.11: Make promises to the Lord your God and keep them. Let all who are around Him bring gifts to Him, Who is to be feared.
76.12: He will cut off the spirit of princes. He is feared by the kings of the earth.

77.1: My voice goes up to God, and I will cry out. My voice goes up to God and He will hear me.
77.2: I looked to the Lord when I was in trouble. I put out my hand at night, and it did not get tired. My soul would not be comforted.
77.3: When I remember God, then I am troubled. When I am in deep thought, then my spirit becomes weak.
77.4: You keep my eyes from closing. I am so troubled that I cannot speak.
77.5: I have thought about the days of old, the years of long ago.
77.6: I remember my song in the night. I think with my heart. And my spirit asks questions.
77.7: Will the Lord turn away forever? Will He never show favor again?
77.8: Has His loving-kindness stopped forever? Has His promise come to an end for all time?
77.9: Has God forgotten to be loving and kind? Has He in anger taken away His loving-pity?
77.10: Then I said, “It is my sorrow that the right hand of the Most High has changed.”
77.11: I will remember the things the Lord has done. Yes, I will remember the powerful works of long ago.
77.12: I will think of all Your work, and keep in mind all the great things You have done.
77.13: O God, Your way is holy. What god is great like our God?
77.14: You are the God Who does great works. You have shown Your power among the people.
77.15: You have set free Your people, the sons of Jacob and Joseph, with Your strong arm.
77.16: The waters saw You, O God. The waters saw You and shook. The sea shook also.
77.17: The clouds poured down water. The sky sounded with thunder. Your arrows of lightning went this way and that.
77.18: The sound of Your thunder was in the turning wind. The lightning lit up the world. The earth shook.
77.19: Your way was through the sea. Your paths went through the powerful waters. And it cannot be known where You stepped.
77.20: You led Your people like a flock by the hand of Moses and Aaron.

78.1: O my people, hear my teaching. Listen to the words of my mouth.
78.2: I will open my mouth in picture-stories. I will tell things which have been kept secret from long ago,
78.3: which we have heard and known because our fathers have told us.
78.4: We will not hide them from their children. But we will tell the children-to-come the praises of the Lord, and of His power and the great things He has done.
78.5: For He has made His will known to Jacob. He made the Law in Israel, which He told our fathers to teach their children.
78.6: So the children-to-come might know, even the children yet to be born. So they may rise up and tell it to their children.
78.7: Then they would put their trust in God and not forget the works of God. And they would keep His Law.
78.8: They would not be like their fathers, who were not right with God and would not obey Him or be faithful to Him.
78.9: The sons of Ephraim were ready with their bows. But they turned away in the day of fighting.
78.10: They did not keep the agreement of God. And they would not walk in His Law.
78.11: They forgot what He had done and His great works that He had shown them.
78.12: He did powerful works in front of their fathers, in the land of Egypt, in the field of Zoan.
78.13: He divided the sea and made them pass through it. He made the water stand up like a wall.
78.14: He led them with the cloud during the day, and with a light of fire during the night.
78.15: He broke the rocks in the desert, and gave them water as if it flowed from the sea.
78.16: He made water come out of the rock. He made the water flow down like rivers.
78.17: But they still kept on sinning against Him. They did not obey the Most High in the desert.
78.18: They tested God in their hearts by asking for the food they wanted.
78.19: Then they spoke against God, saying, “Can God set a table in the desert?
78.20: See, He hit the rock and water poured out and rivers flowed over. Can He give bread also? Will He give meat to His people?”
78.21: The Lord was full of anger when He heard them. And a fire was set against Jacob. His anger went up against Israel,
78.22: because they did not believe in God. They did not trust in Him to save them.
78.23: Yet He spoke to the clouds above, and opened the doors of heaven.
78.24: He sent down bread from heaven for them to eat. He gave them food from heaven.
78.25: Men ate the bread of angels. He sent them all the food they could eat.
78.26: He made the east wind blow in the heavens. And He brought in the south wind by His power.
78.27: He sent meat down on them like dust, winged birds like the sand of the sea.
78.28: He let them fall in the place where they were staying, all around their tents.
78.29: So they ate until they were full. He gave them what they wanted.
78.30: But before they had eaten all they wanted, even while it was still in their mouths,
78.31: the anger of God came upon them. And He killed the strongest of them. He cut down the young men of Israel.
78.32: But still they kept on sinning. They did not believe in His powerful works.
78.33: So He made their days come to nothing. He made their years end in fear all at once.
78.34: When He killed some of them, the others would look for Him. They returned and looked for God.
78.35: They remembered that God was their rock, and that the Most High God was the One Who set them free.
78.36: But they gave Him false honor with their mouth. They lied to Him with their tongue.
78.37: For their heart was not right toward Him. They were not faithful to His agreement.
78.38: But He showed them loving-kindness and forgave their sins. He did not destroy them. He held back His anger many times. He did not let all of His anger loose.
78.39: He remembered that they were only flesh, a wind that passes and does not return.
78.40: How many times they went against Him in the desert, and gave Him sorrow in that empty land!
78.41: They put God to the test again and again, and troubled the Holy One of Israel.
78.42: They did not remember His power and the day He saved them from those who hated them,
78.43: when He did His powerful works in Egypt and showed His greatness in the field of Zoan.
78.44: He changed their rivers into blood. They could not drink from their rivers.
78.45: He sent many flies among them that ate them, and frogs that destroyed them.
78.46: He gave their fields of food to the grasshopper, and all they worked for to the locust.
78.47: He destroyed their vines with hail, and their sycamore trees with cold.
78.48: He killed their cattle with hail and lightning.
78.49: He sent them His burning anger and trouble. He sent a group of angels to bring trouble and sorrow to them.
78.50: He made a straight path for His anger. He did not save their soul from death. But He gave their lives over to all these troubles.
78.51: He killed all the first-born in Egypt, the first children of their strength in the tents of Ham.
78.52: But He brought His people out like sheep. And He led them like a flock in the desert.
78.53: He led them and kept them safe, so they were not afraid. But the sea covered those who hated them.
78.54: He brought them to His holy land, to the hill country His right hand had taken.
78.55: He drove out the nations before them. He gave them parts of the land for a gift. And He made the families of Israel live in their tents.
78.56: But they tempted and went against the Most High God. They did not keep His Law.
78.57: They turned away and acted without faith like their fathers. They were like a bow that cannot be trusted.
78.58: They made Him angry with their sinful places of worship. And they made Him jealous with their false gods.
78.59: God was very angry when He heard them, and He hated Israel.
78.60: He left the holy tent at Shiloh, the tent He had set up among men.
78.61: And He let His strength be taken. He put His greatness into the hands of those who hated Israel.
78.62: He allowed His people to be killed with the sword. And He was very angry with those who belong to Him.
78.63: Fire burned up their young men. And their young women had no wedding songs.
78.64: Their religious leaders fell by the sword. And the women who lost their husbands could not cry.
78.65: Then the Lord woke up as if from sleep, like a strong man wild with wine.
78.66: He beat back those who hated Him. And He put them to shame forever.
78.67: He turned away from the tent of Joseph. He did not choose the family of Ephraim,
78.68: but chose the family of Judah, Mount Zion which He loved.
78.69: He built His holy place like the high mountains, like the earth He has built forever.
78.70: He chose David, His servant and took him from the flocks of sheep.
78.71: He brought him from caring for the sheep and their lambs to being the shepherd of Jacob His people, and Israel who belongs to Him.
78.72: So David was their shepherd with a heart that was right, and led them with good hands and wisdom.

79.1: O God, the nations have come into the land of Your people. They have made Your holy house dirty. They have crushed the walls and buildings of Jerusalem.
79.2: They have given the dead bodies of Your servants to the birds of the heavens for food. The flesh of those who belong to You has been given to the wild animals of the earth.
79.3: They have poured out their blood like water all around Jerusalem. And there was no one to bury them.
79.4: We have become a shame to our neighbors. Those around us laugh at and make fun of us.
79.5: How long, O Lord? Will You be angry forever? Will Your jealousy burn like fire?
79.6: Pour out Your anger on the nations that do not know You, and on the nations that do not call on Your name.
79.7: For they have destroyed Jacob. They have laid waste the place where he lived.
79.8: Do not hold the sins of our fathers against us. Let Your loving-pity come fast to meet us. For we are in much need.
79.9: O God Who saves us, help us for the honor of Your name. Take us out of trouble and forgive our sins, for the honor of Your name.
79.10: Why should the nations say, “Where is their God?” Make it known among the nations, in front of our eyes, that You punish for the blood that has poured from Your servants.
79.11: Hear the cries of those in prison. By the greatness of Your power, save those who are being sent to death.
79.12: And return to our neighbors seven times the shame that they have brought You, O Lord.
79.13: Then we Your people, the sheep of Your field, will give thanks to You forever. We will tell of Your praise to all the people of all times.

80.1: Hear us, O Shepherd of Israel, You Who lead Joseph like a flock! You Who sit on Your throne above the angels, let Your light shine!
80.2: Stir up Your power in front of Ephraim and Benjamin and Manassah, and come to save us!
80.3: O God, bring us back to You. Make Your face shine upon us, that we may be saved.
80.4: O Lord God of all, how long will You be angry with the prayers of Your people?
80.5: You have fed them with the bread of tears. And You have made them drink a big amount of tears.
80.6: You have made us an object of arguing to our neighbors. Those who hate us laugh among themselves.
80.7: O God of all, bring us back to You. Make Your face shine upon us, and we will be saved.
80.8: You brought a vine out of Egypt. You drove out the nations, and You planted it.
80.9: You cleared the land for it. And its roots went deep and filled the land.
80.10: The mountains were covered with its shadow. And the tall trees were covered with its branches.
80.11: It sent out its branches to the sea, and its new branches to the River.
80.12: Why have You broken down its walls so that all who pass by pick its fruit?
80.13: The wild pig from among the trees eats it away. And whatever moves in the field eats from it.
80.14: O God of all, we beg You to return. Look down from heaven and see. Take care of this vine.
80.15: Take care of the root Your right hand has planted, and the branch that You have raised up for Yourself.
80.16: They have burned it with fire. It is cut down. May they be lost when they hear Your strong words.
80.17: Let Your hand be upon the man of Your right hand, the son of man you have made strong for Yourself.
80.18: Then we will not turn away from You. Give us new life again, and we will call on Your name.
80.19: O Lord God of all, bring us back to You. Make Your face shine upon us, and we will be saved.

81.1: Sing for joy to God our strength! Call out for joy to the God of Jacob!
81.2: Sing a song, beat the timbrel. Play the sweet-sounding harps.
81.3: Blow the horn at the new moon, at the full moon on the day of our special supper.
81.4: For this is a Law for Israel, a Law of the God of Jacob.
81.5: He made it a Law for Joseph, when he went through the land of Egypt. I heard a language that I did not know:
81.6: “I took the load off his shoulders. His hands were set free from the basket.
81.7: You called in your trouble, and I took you out of it. I answered you in the hiding place of thunder. I tested you at the waters of Meribah.
81.8: Hear, O My people, and I will tell you what to do. O Israel, if you would listen to Me!
81.9: Let there be no strange god among you. Do not worship any false god.
81.10: I, the Lord, am your God. I brought you out of the land of Egypt. Open your mouth wide and I will fill it.
81.11: “But My people did not listen to My voice. And Israel did not obey Me.
81.12: So I let them follow the desires of their sinful hearts. They followed their own plans.
81.13: If only My people would listen to Me! If only Israel would follow My ways!
81.14: I would hurry to crush those who fight against them. I would turn My hand against those who hate them.
81.15: Those who hate the Lord would pretend to obey Him. And their punishment would last forever.
81.16: But I would feed you with the best of grain. And I would fill you with honey from the rock.”

82.1: God takes His stand in the great meeting of His people. He judges among the rulers.
82.2: How long will you rulers be wrong in how you judge? How long will you show favor to the sinful?
82.3: Do the right thing for the weak and those without a father. Stand up for the rights of those who are suffering and in need.
82.4: Save the weak and those in need. Set them free from the hand of the sinful.
82.5: They know nothing; they understand nothing. They walk around in the dark. All that the earth is built upon is shaking.
82.6: I said, “You are gods. You are all sons of the Most High.
82.7: But you will die like men, and fall like one of the princes.”
82.8: Rise up, O God! Say who is guilty or not guilty upon the earth! For all the nations belong to You.

83.1: O God, do not keep quiet. Do not be quiet, O God, and do not hold Your peace.
83.2: For, look, those who hate You are making much noise. Those who fight against You have honored themselves.
83.3: They make bad plans against Your people. They plan against those You care for.
83.4: They say, “Come, let us destroy them as a nation. Let the name of Israel be remembered no longer.”
83.5: For they plan together with one mind. They make an agreement against You:
83.6: The tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites; Moab and the Hagarites;
83.7: Gebal, and Ammon, and Amalek; Philistia with those who live in Tyre;
83.8: Assyria has joined them also. They help the children of Lot.
83.9: Do to them as You did to Midian, and to Sisera and Jabin at the river of Kishon.
83.10: They were destroyed at Endor. They were spread over the field.
83.11: Make their respected men like Oreb and Zeeb. Make their princes like Zebah and Zalmunna,
83.12: who said, “Let us take for ourselves the fields of God.”
83.13: O my God, make them like dust turning in the wind, like parts of the grass that have no worth and are blown away.
83.14: As the fire that burns up the trees and spreads over the mountains,
83.15: so go behind them with Your storm. Make them afraid with Your storm.
83.16: Fill their faces with shame, so they will look to Your name, O Lord.
83.17: Let them be ashamed and afraid forever. Let them be put to shame and lost.
83.18: Then they may know that You alone, Whose name is the Lord, are the Most High over all the earth.

84.1: How beautiful are the places where You live, O Lord of all!
84.2: My soul wants and even becomes weak from wanting to be in the house of the Lord. My heart and my flesh sing for joy to the living God.
84.3: Even the bird has found a home. The swallow has found a nest for herself where she may lay her young at Your altars, O Lord of all, my King and my God.
84.4: How happy are those who live in Your house! They are always giving thanks to You.
84.5: How happy is the man whose strength is in You and in whose heart are the roads to Zion!
84.6: As they pass through the dry valley of Baca, they make it a place of good water. The early rain fills the pools with good also.
84.7: They go from strength to strength. Every one of them stands before God in Zion.
84.8: O Lord God of all, hear my prayer. Listen, O God of Jacob.
84.9: Look upon our safe-covering, O God. And look upon the face of Your chosen one.
84.10: For a day in Your house is better than a thousand outside. I would rather be the one who opens the door of the house of my God, than to live in the tents of the sinful.
84.11: For the Lord God is a sun and a safe-covering. The Lord gives favor and honor. He holds back nothing good from those who walk in the way that is right.
84.12: O Lord of all, how happy is the man who trusts in You!

85.1: O Lord, You showed favor to Your land. You have returned those of Jacob who were taken away.
85.2: You have forgiven the sins of Your people. You have covered all their sin.
85.3: You have taken away all Your anger. You have turned away from Your burning anger.
85.4: O God Who saves us, give us life again. Make Your anger toward us stop.
85.5: Will You be angry with us forever? Will You spread out Your anger to families of all times?
85.6: Will You not bring us back to life again so that Your people may be happy in You?
85.7: Show us Your loving-kindness, O Lord, and save us.
85.8: I will listen to what God the Lord will say. For He will speak peace to His people, to those who are right with Him. But do not let them turn again to foolish things.
85.9: For sure His saving power is near those who fear Him, so His shining-greatness may live in the land.
85.10: Loving-kindness and truth have met together. Peace and what is right and good have kissed each other.
85.11: Truth comes up from the earth. And what is right and good looks down from heaven.
85.12: Yes, the Lord will give what is good. And our land will give its fruit.
85.13: What is right and good will go before Him and make a way for His steps.

86.1: Hear, O Lord, and answer me. For I am suffering and in need.
86.2: Keep my life, for I am faithful to You. You are my God. Save Your servant who trusts in You.
86.3: Show me loving-kindness, O Lord. For I cry to You all day long.
86.4: Bring joy to Your servant. For I lift up my soul to You, O Lord.
86.5: For You are good and ready to forgive, O Lord. You are rich in loving-kindness to all who call to You.
86.6: Hear my prayer, O Lord. Listen to my cry for help.
86.7: I will call to You in the day of my trouble. For You will answer me.
86.8: There is no one like You among the gods, O Lord. And there are no works like Yours.
86.9: All the nations You have made will come and worship before You, O Lord. And they will bring honor to Your name.
86.10: For You are great and do great things. You alone are God.
86.11: Teach me Your way, O Lord. I will walk in Your truth. May my heart fear Your name.
86.12: O Lord my God, I will give thanks to You with all my heart. I will bring honor to Your name forever.
86.13: For Your loving-kindness toward me is great. And You have saved my soul from the bottom of the grave.
86.14: O God, proud men have come up against me. A group of fighting men want to take my life. And they do not think of You.
86.15: But You, O Lord, are a God full of love and pity. You are slow to anger and rich in loving-kindness and truth.
86.16: Turn to me, and show me loving-kindness. Give Your strength to Your servant. And save the son of your woman servant.
86.17: Give me something special to see of Your favor. Then those who hate me may see it and be ashamed. Because You, O Lord, have helped me and comforted me.

87.1: The city God built stands on the holy mountains.
87.2: The Lord loves the gates of Zion more than all the other places of Jacob.
87.3: Great things are said about you, O city of God.
87.4: I will say that Rahab and Babylon are among those who know Me. Look, Philistia and Tyre and Ethiopia say, “This one was born there.”
87.5: But it will be said of Zion, “This one and that one were born in her.” And the Most High Himself will make her strong.
87.6: The Lord will write in the book of the people, “This one was born there.”
87.7: Then those who sing and those who play music will say, “All my wells of joy are in you.”

88.1: O Lord, the God Who saves me, I have cried out before You day and night.
88.2: Let my prayer come to You. Listen to my cry.
88.3: For my soul is filled with troubles. And my life comes near the grave.
88.4: I am added among those who go down into the deep hole. I am like a man without strength.
88.5: I am left among the dead, like those who have been killed and lie in the grave, whom You remember no more. They are cut off from Your help.
88.6: You have put me in the deepest hole, in a dark and deep place.
88.7: Your anger has rested upon me. And You have troubled me with all Your waves.
88.8: You have taken my good friends far from me. You have made me hated by them. I am shut in and cannot go out.
88.9: My eyes have become weak because of trouble. I have called to You every day, O Lord. I have spread out my hands to You.
88.10: Will You show Your great works to the dead? Will the dead rise and praise You?
88.11: Will Your loving-kindness be told about in the grave, and how faithful You are in the place that destroys?
88.12: Will Your great works be known in the darkness, and Your right and good works in the land where all is forgotten?
88.13: But I have cried to You for help, O Lord. My prayer comes to You in the morning.
88.14: O Lord, why do You turn away from me? Why do You hide Your face from me?
88.15: I have been troubled and near death since I was young. I have suffered Your punishment. And I cannot win.
88.16: Your burning anger has passed over me. The punishment You have sent destroys me.
88.17: They gather around me like water all day long. Together they close in upon me.
88.18: You have taken my friend and loved one far from me. Friends that were near to me are in darkness.

89.1: I will sing of the loving-kindness of the Lord forever. I will make known with my mouth how faithful You are to all people.
89.2: For I said, “Loving-kindness will be built up forever. You will make known how faithful You are in the heavens.”
89.3: You said, “I have made an agreement with My chosen one. I have promised to David, Your servant.
89.4: I will make your seed last forever. I will build up your throne for all the children-to-come.”
89.5: O Lord, the heavens will praise Your great works and how faithful You are in the meeting of the holy ones.
89.6: For who in the heavens is like the Lord? Who among the sons of the powerful is like the Lord?
89.7: God is honored with fear in the meeting of the holy ones. He is honored with fear more than all who are around Him.
89.8: Lord God of all, powerful Lord, who is like You? All around You we see how faithful You are.
89.9: You rule over the rising sea. When its waves rise, You quiet them.
89.10: You have crushed Rahab like one who is killed. You have destroyed those who hate You with Your powerful arm.
89.11: The heavens are Yours; and the earth is Yours. You have made the world and all that is in it.
89.12: You have made from nothing the north and the south. Tabor and Hermon call out for joy at Your name.
89.13: You have a strong arm. Your hand is powerful. Your right hand is honored.
89.14: Your throne stands on what is right and fair. Loving-kindness and truth go before You.
89.15: How happy are the people who know the sound of joy! They walk in the light of Your face, O Lord.
89.16: They are full of joy in Your name all day long. And by being right with You, they are honored.
89.17: For You are the shining-greatness of their strength. And our horn is lifted high by Your favor.
89.18: For our safe-covering belongs to the Lord. And our king belongs to the Holy One of Israel.
89.19: Once You spoke in a special dream to Your faithful ones, saying: “I have given help to a powerful one. I have honored a chosen one from among the people.
89.20: I have found David, Your servant. I have poured My holy oil upon him.
89.21: My hand will stay with him. And My arm will give him strength.
89.22: Those who hate him will not fool him. No sinful man will bring trouble to him.
89.23: But he will see Me crush those who fight against him. I will kill those who hate him.
89.24: I will be faithful and My loving-kindness will be with him. And in My name he will become great.
89.25: I will set his hand on the sea also, and his right hand on the rivers.
89.26: He will cry to Me, ‘You are my Father, my God, and the rock that saves me.’
89.27: I will make him My first-born also, the highest of the kings of the earth.
89.28: I will keep My loving-kindness for him forever. And My agreement with him will be made strong.
89.29: I will make his seed last forever. And his throne will last as long as heaven.
89.30: “If his sons leave My Law and do not do what I say,
89.31: and if they break My Laws and do not obey My Word,
89.32: then I will punish their sin with the stick, and their wrong-doing with the whip.
89.33: But I will not take my loving-kindness from him. I will always be faithful to him.
89.34: I will not break My agreement, or change what was spoken by My lips.
89.35: Once I have promised by My holy name, I will not lie to David.
89.36: His seed will last forever. And his throne will last before Me like the sun.
89.37: It will last forever like the moon, which may always be seen in the sky.”
89.38: But You have thrown off and turned away from Your chosen one. You have been full of anger against him.
89.39: You have hated the agreement with Your servant. You have made his crown dirty in the dust.
89.40: You have broken down all his walls. You have destroyed his strong places.
89.41: All who pass on the road rob him. He has become a shame to his neighbors.
89.42: You have honored the right hand of those who fight against him. You have made all who hate him glad.
89.43: You have turned away the sharp part of his sword. And You have not made him stand in a fight.
89.44: You have put an end to what shows of his greatness, and have thrown his throne to the ground.
89.45: You have made him old before his time, and have covered him with shame.
89.46: How long, O Lord? Will You hide Yourself forever? Will Your anger burn like fire?
89.47: Remember how fast my life is passing. You have made all men for nothing.
89.48: What man can live and not see death? Can he save himself from the power of the grave?
89.49: O Lord, where is the loving-kindness You used to have, that You promised in faith to David?
89.50: O Lord, remember the shame of those who work for You. Remember how I carry near my heart the shame of all the nations.
89.51: Those who hate You have put us to shame, O Lord. They have put to shame the footsteps of Your chosen one.
89.52: Praise the Lord forever! Let it be so.

90.1: Lord, You have been the place of comfort for all people of all time.
90.2: Before the mountains were born, before You gave birth to the earth and the world, forever and ever, You are God.
90.3: You change man into dust again, and say, “Return, O children of men.”
90.4: For a thousand years in Your eyes are like yesterday when it passes by, or like the hours of the night.
90.5: You carry men away as with a flood. They fall asleep. In the morning they are like the new grass that grows.
90.6: It grows well in the morning, but dries up and dies by evening.
90.7: For we are burned up by Your anger. By Your anger we are troubled and afraid.
90.8: You have set our wrong-doing before You, our secret sins in the light of Your face.
90.9: For all our days pass away in Your anger. We finish our years with a quiet cry.
90.10: The days of our life are seventy years, or eighty if we have the strength. Yet the best of them are only hard work and sorrow. For they are soon gone and we fly away.
90.11: Who understands the power of Your anger? Your anger is as great as the fear that we should have for You.
90.12: Teach us to understand how many days we have. Then we will have a heart of wisdom to give You.
90.13: Return, O Lord. How long will it be? Have pity upon those who work for You.
90.14: Fill us in the morning with Your loving-kindness. Let us sing for joy and be glad all our days.
90.15: Make us glad for as many days as You have made us suffer, and for the years we have seen trouble.
90.16: Let Your work be shown to Your servants. And let Your wonderful greatness be shown to their children.
90.17: Let the favor of the Lord our God be upon us. And make the work of our hands stand strong. Yes, make the work of our hands stand strong.

91.1: He who lives in the safe place of the Most High will be in the shadow of the All-powerful.
91.2: I will say to the Lord, “You are my safe and strong place, my God, in Whom I trust.”
91.3: For it is He Who takes you away from the trap, and from the killing sickness.
91.4: He will cover you with His wings. And under His wings you will be safe. He is faithful like a safe-covering and a strong wall.
91.5: You will not be afraid of trouble at night, or of the arrow that flies by day.
91.6: You will not be afraid of the sickness that walks in darkness, or of the trouble that destroys at noon.
91.7: A thousand may fall at your side, and ten thousand at your right hand. But it will not come near you.
91.8: You will only look on with your eyes, and see how the sinful are punished.
91.9: Because you have made the Lord your safe place, and the Most High the place where you live,
91.10: nothing will hurt you. No trouble will come near your tent.
91.11: For He will tell His angels to care for you and keep you in all your ways.
91.12: They will hold you up in their hands. So your foot will not hit against a stone.
91.13: You will walk upon the lion and the snake. You will crush under your feet the young lion and the snake.
91.14: Because he has loved Me, I will bring him out of trouble. I will set him in a safe place on high, because he has known My name.
91.15: He will call upon Me, and I will answer him. I will be with him in trouble. I will take him out of trouble and honor him.
91.16: I will please him with a long life. And I will show him My saving power.

92.1: It is good to give thanks to the Lord, and sing praises to Your name, O Most High.
92.2: It is good to tell of Your loving-kindness in the morning, and of how faithful You are at night,
92.3: with harps, and with music of praise.
92.4: For You have made me glad by what You have done, O Lord. I will sing for joy at the works of Your hands.
92.5: How great are Your works, O Lord! How deep are Your thoughts!
92.6: A man who cannot reason does not have much learning. A fool does not understand this.
92.7: Even if the sinful grow up like grass and all goes well with wrong-doers, they will be destroyed forever.
92.8: But You, O Lord, rule from Your high place forever.
92.9: For, look, those who hate You will be lost from You forever, O Lord. All those who do wrong will be destroyed.
92.10: But You have lifted up my horn like that of a wild bull. New oil has been poured upon me.
92.11: My eyes have seen those who wait to hurt me. My ears hear the bad men who rise up against me.
92.12: The man who is right and good will grow like the palm tree. He will grow like a tall tree in Lebanon.
92.13: Planted in the house of the Lord, they will grow well in the home of our God.
92.14: They will still give fruit when they are old. They will be full of life and strength.
92.15: And they will show that the Lord is faithful. He is my rock. There is nothing in Him that is not right and good.

93.1: The Lord rules. He is dressed with great power. The Lord has dressed Himself with strength. For sure, the world is built to last. It will not be moved.
93.2: Your throne is set up from long ago. You have always been.
93.3: The floods have lifted up, O Lord. The floods have lifted up their voice. The floods lift up their beating waves.
93.4: The Lord on high is more powerful than the sound of many waters and the strong waves of the sea.
93.5: Your Word is very sure. O Lord, Your house is holy forever.

94.1: O Lord, the God Who punishes, God Who punishes, let Your light shine!
94.2: Rise up, You Judge of the earth. Pay what is owed to the proud.
94.3: How long will the sinful, O Lord, how long will the sinful be full of joy?
94.4: They pour out proud words. All those who do wrong, talk about themselves as if they are great people.
94.5: They crush Your people, O Lord. They bring trouble upon Your chosen nation.
94.6: They kill the woman whose husband has died and the stranger. They kill the children who have no parents.
94.7: And they say, “The Lord does not see. The God of Jacob does not care.”
94.8: Listen, you foolish ones among the people. You fools, when will you understand?
94.9: He Who made the ear, does He not hear? He Who made the eye, does He not see?
94.10: He Who punishes nations so they might give up sin, will He not speak strong words to them? Is He not the One Who teaches man all he knows?
94.11: The Lord knows the thoughts of man. He knows that they are empty.
94.12: Happy is the man who is punished until he gives up sin, O Lord, and whom You teach from Your Law.
94.13: You give him rest from days of trouble, until a hole is dug for the sinful.
94.14: For the Lord will not turn away from His people. He will not leave His chosen nation.
94.15: For what is decided will be right and good. And all those whose hearts are right will follow it.
94.16: Who will rise up for me against the sinful? Who will take a stand for me against those who do wrong?
94.17: If the Lord had not been my help, my soul would soon have been among the dead.
94.18: When I said, “My foot is going out from under me,” Your loving-kindness held me up, O Lord.
94.19: When my worry is great within me, Your comfort brings joy to my soul.
94.20: Can a sinful throne that brings trouble by its laws be a friend to You?
94.21: They join together against the life of those who are right and good. They send those who are not guilty to their death.
94.22: But the Lord has been my strong place, my God, and the rock where I am safe.
94.23: He has brought back their own sin upon them and will destroy them for their wrong-doing. The Lord our God will destroy them.

95.1: Come, let us sing with joy to the Lord. Let us sing loud with joy to the rock Who saves us.
95.2: Let us come before Him giving thanks. Let us make a sound of joy to Him with songs.
95.3: For the Lord is a great God, and a great King above all gods.
95.4: The deep places of the earth are in His hand. And the tops of the mountains belong to Him.
95.5: The sea is His, for He made it. And His hands made the dry land.
95.6: Come, let us bow down in worship. Let us get down on our knees before the Lord Who made us.
95.7: For He is our God. And we are the people of His field, and the sheep of His hand. If you hear His voice today,
95.8: do not let your hearts become hard as you did at Meribah, as you did that day at Massah in the desert.
95.9: Your early fathers put Me to the test and tried Me. But they had seen the work I did.
95.10: I was angry with the people of that day for forty years. I said, “They always think wrong thoughts. And they do not know My ways.”
95.11: I was angry with them and said, “They will never go into My rest.”

96.1: Sing to the Lord a new song. Let all the earth sing to the Lord.
96.2: Sing to the Lord. Honor His name. Make His saving power known from day to day.
96.3: Tell of His shining-greatness among the nations. Tell of His wonderful works among all the people.
96.4: For the Lord is great and should be given much praise. He is to be honored with fear above all gods.
96.5: For all the gods of the nations are false gods. But the Lord made the heavens.
96.6: Honor and great power are with Him. Strength and beauty are in His holy place.
96.7: Give to the Lord, O families of the nations, give to the Lord the honor and strength that He should have.
96.8: Give to the Lord the honor of His name. Bring a gift and come into His holy place.
96.9: Worship the Lord in holy clothing. May all the earth shake in fear before Him.
96.10: Say among the nations that the Lord rules. The world is built to last. It will not be moved. He will be right when He says who is guilty or not.
96.11: Let the heavens be glad. And let the earth be full of joy. Let the sea and all that is in it make a loud noise.
96.12: Let the fields and all that is in them be full of joy. Then all the trees of the land will sing for joy
96.13: before the Lord. For He is coming. He is coming to say who is guilty or not on the earth. He will be right in what He decides about the world. And He will be faithful to the people.

97.1: The Lord rules. Let the earth be full of joy. Let the many islands be glad.
97.2: Clouds and darkness are all around Him. His throne is built upon what is right and fair.
97.3: Fire goes before Him and burns up those who hate Him on every side.
97.4: His lightning lights up the world. The earth sees, and shakes.
97.5: The mountains melt like a candle before the Lord, before the Lord of the whole earth.
97.6: The heavens tell about how right and good He is. And all the people see His shining-greatness.
97.7: Let all those who serve false gods be ashamed, those who talk about how great their gods are. Worship Him, all you gods!
97.8: Zion heard this and was glad. The people of Judah have been full of joy because of what You decide, O Lord.
97.9: For You are the Lord Most High over all the earth. You are honored above all gods.
97.10: Let those who love the Lord hate what is bad. For He keeps safe the souls of His faithful ones. He takes them away from the hand of the sinful.
97.11: Light is spread like seed for those who are right and good, and joy for the pure in heart.
97.12: Be glad in the Lord, you who are right and good. Give thanks to His holy name.

98.1: Sing a new song to the Lord. For He has done great things. His right hand and His holy arm have won the fight for Him.
98.2: The Lord has made His saving power known. He has shown to the nations how right and good He is.
98.3: He has shown His loving-kindness and how beautiful He is to the house of Israel. All the ends of the earth have seen the saving power of our God.
98.4: Call out for joy to the Lord, all the earth. Sing out loud songs of joy and sing praises.
98.5: Sing praises to the Lord with harps, with harps and the voice of singing.
98.6: Call out for joy with the sound of horns before the King, the Lord.
98.7: Let the sea and all that is in it make a loud noise, and the world and all who live in it.
98.8: Let the rivers clap their hands. Let the mountains sing together for joy
98.9: before the Lord. For He is coming to say who is guilty or not on the earth. He will be right in what He decides about the world. And He will be fair to the people.

99.1: The Lord rules! Let the people shake in fear! He sits on His throne above the angels. Let the earth shake!
99.2: The Lord is great in Zion. And He is honored above all people.
99.3: Let them praise Your great name. It is to be honored with fear. He is holy!
99.4: The strength of the King loves what is right. You have set up what is fair. You do what is right and fair in Jacob.
99.5: Honor the Lord our God. Worship at His feet. For He is holy!
99.6: Moses and Aaron were among His religious leaders. And Samuel was among those who called on His name. They called upon the Lord, and He answered them.
