99.7: He spoke to them from the cloud. They kept His Word and the Law that He gave them.
99.8: O Lord our God, You answered them. You were a forgiving God to them. But You punished them for their wrong-doing.
99.9: Honor the Lord our God. And worship at His holy mountain. For the Lord our God is holy!

100.1: Call out with joy to the Lord, all the earth.
100.2: Be glad as you serve the Lord. Come before Him with songs of joy.
100.3: Know that the Lord is God. It is He Who made us, and not we ourselves. We are His people and the sheep of His field.
100.4: Go into His gates giving thanks and into His holy place with praise. Give thanks to Him. Honor His name.
100.5: For the Lord is good. His loving-kindness lasts forever. And He is faithful to all people and to all their children-to-come.

101.1: I will sing of loving-kindness and of what is right and fair. I will sing praises to You, O Lord.
101.2: I will be careful to live a life without blame. When will You come to me? I will walk within my house with a right and good heart.
101.3: I will set no sinful thing in front of my eyes. I hate the work of those who are not faithful. It will not get hold of me.
101.4: A sinful heart will be far from me. I will have nothing to do with sin.
101.5: I will stop whoever talks against his neighbor in secret. I will not listen to anyone who has a proud look and a proud heart.
101.6: My eyes will look with favor on the faithful in the land, so they may serve me. He who walks without blame will help me.
101.7: He whose ways are false will not live in my house. He who tells lies will not stand in front of me.
101.8: I will destroy all the sinful in the land every morning. I will cut off all those who do wrong from the city of the Lord.

102.1: Hear my prayer, O Lord! Let my cry for help come to You.
102.2: Do not hide Your face from me in the day of my trouble. Turn Your ear to me. Hurry to answer me in the day when I call.
102.3: For my days go up in smoke. And my bones are burned as with fire.
102.4: My heart is crushed and dried like grass. And I forget to eat my food.
102.5: I am nothing but skin and bones because of my loud cries.
102.6: I am like a pelican in the desert. I am like an owl of the waste places.
102.7: I lie awake. And I feel like a bird alone on the roof.
102.8: Those who hate me have made it hard for me all day long. Those who are angry with me curse my name.
102.9: For I have eaten ashes like bread and have mixed my drink with tears,
102.10: because of Your great anger. For You have lifted me up and thrown me away.
102.11: My days are like the evening shadow. I dried up like grass.
102.12: But You and Your name, O Lord, will always be forever and to all people for all time.
102.13: You will rise up and have loving-pity on Zion. For it is time to show favor to her. The set time has come.
102.14: For Your servants respect her stones and show pity for her dust.
102.15: The nations will fear the name of the Lord. All the kings of the earth will fear Your shining-greatness.
102.16: For the Lord has built up Zion. He will come in His shining-greatness.
102.17: He will answer the prayer of those in need. He will not turn from their prayer.
102.18: This will be written for the children-to-come. So a people not yet born may give thanks to the Lord.
102.19: For He looked down from His holy place. He watched the earth from heaven,
102.20: to hear the loud cries of those in prison and to set free those who are being sent to death.
102.21: So the name of the Lord will be made known in Zion and His praise in Jerusalem,
102.22: when the people gather together and the nations gather to serve the Lord.
102.23: He has taken away my strength. He has taken days from my life.
102.24: I said, “O my God, do not take me away when my days are only half done. Your years go on to all people of all time.
102.25: You made the earth in the beginning. You made the heavens with Your hands.
102.26: They will be destroyed but You will always live. They will all become old as clothing becomes old. You will change them like a coat. And they will be changed,
102.27: but You are always the same. Your years will never end.
102.28: The children of those who work for You will live on. And their children will be set before You.”

103.1: Praise the Lord, O my soul. And all that is within me, praise His holy name.
103.2: Praise the Lord, O my soul. And forget none of His acts of kindness.
103.3: He forgives all my sins. He heals all my diseases.
103.4: He saves my life from the grave. He crowns me with loving-kindness and pity.
103.5: He fills my years with good things and I am made young again like the eagle.
103.6: The Lord does what is right and fair for all who suffer under a bad power.
103.7: He made His ways known to Moses and His acts to the people of Israel.
103.8: The Lord is full of loving-pity and kindness. He is slow to anger and has much loving-kindness.
103.9: He will not always keep after us. And He will not keep His anger back forever.
103.10: He has not punished us enough for all our sins. He has not paid us back for all our wrong-doings.
103.11: For His loving-kindness for those who fear Him is as great as the heavens are high above the earth.
103.12: He has taken our sins from us as far as the east is from the west.
103.13: The Lord has loving-pity on those who fear Him, as a father has loving-pity on his children.
103.14: For He knows what we are made of. He remembers that we are dust.
103.15: The days of man are like grass. He grows like a flower of the field.
103.16: When the wind blows over it, it is gone. Its place will remember it no more.
103.17: But the loving-kindness of the Lord is forever and forever on those who fear Him. And what is right with God is given forever to their children’s children,
103.18: to those who keep His agreement and remember to obey His Law.
103.19: The Lord has set up His throne in the heavens. And His holy nation rules over all.
103.20: Praise the Lord, you powerful angels of His who do what He says, obeying His voice as He speaks!
103.21: Praise the Lord, all you armies of His who work for Him and do what pleases Him.
103.22: Praise the Lord, all His works in all places under His rule. Praise the Lord, O my soul!

104.1: Praise the Lord, O my soul! O Lord my God, You are very great. You are dressed with great honor and wonderful power.
104.2: He covers Himself with light as with a coat. He spreads out the heavens like a tent.
104.3: He makes His home on the waters. He makes the clouds His wagon. He rides on the wings of the wind.
104.4: He makes the winds carry His news. He makes His helpers a burning fire.
104.5: He set the earth in its place so that it will stay that way forever.
104.6: You covered it with the sea as with a coat. The waters stood above the mountains.
104.7: The waters left at Your strong words. They went away in a hurry at the sound of Your thunder.
104.8: The mountains went up and the valleys went down to the place that You made for them.
104.9: You set a place that they may not pass over. The waters will never cover the earth again.
104.10: He sends rivers into the valleys. They flow between the mountains.
104.11: They give water to all the animals of the field. The wild donkeys drink until they are no longer thirsty.
104.12: The birds of the sky nest beside them. They sing among the branches.
104.13: He waters the mountains from His home above. The earth is filled with the fruit of His works.
104.14: He makes the grass grow for the cattle, and plants for man to use. So He may bring food from the earth,
104.15: wine that makes man’s heart glad, oil to make his face shine, and food to make his heart strong.
104.16: The tall cedar trees that the Lord planted in Lebanon drink their fill.
104.17: The birds make their nests there. The stork has its nest in the green trees.
104.18: The high mountains are for the wild goats. The rocks are a safe place for the badgers.
104.19: He made the moon to mark the time of year. And the sun knows when to go down.
104.20: You make darkness and it becomes night. Then all the wild animals among the trees come out.
104.21: The young lions make a loud noise as they go after meat. And they get their food from God.
104.22: They go to their homes and lie down when the sun rises.
104.23: Then man goes out to his work and works until evening.
104.24: O Lord, how many are Your works! You made them all in wisdom. The earth is full of what You have made.
104.25: There is the wide sea full of both large and small animals. There are too many for us to number.
104.26: The ships sail there. And the very large sea animal You have made plays in it.
104.27: They all wait for You to give them their food at the right time.
104.28: You give it to them and they gather it up. You open Your hand and they are filled with good things.
104.29: They are troubled and afraid when You hide Your face. And when You take away their breath, they die and return to the dust.
104.30: They are made when You send Your Spirit. And You make the land of the earth new again.
104.31: May the shining-greatness of the Lord last forever. May the Lord be glad in His works.
104.32: He looks at the earth and it shakes with fear. He touches the mountains and they smoke.
104.33: I will sing to the Lord all my life. I will sing praise to my God as long as I live.
104.34: May the words of my heart be pleasing to Him. As for me, I will be glad in the Lord.
104.35: Let sinners be destroyed from the earth. And let the sinful be no more. Honor the Lord, O my soul! Praise the Lord!

105.1: O give thanks to the Lord. Call on His name. Make His works known among the people.
105.2: Sing to Him. Sing praises to Him. Tell of all His great works.
105.3: Honor His holy name. Let the heart of those who look to the Lord be glad.
105.4: Look for the Lord and His strength. Look for His face all the time.
105.5: Remember the great and powerful works that He has done. Keep in mind what He has decided and told us,
105.6: O children of His servant Abraham, O sons of Jacob, His chosen ones!
105.7: He is the Lord our God. What He has decided is in all the earth.
105.8: He has remembered His agreement forever, the promise He made to last through a thousand families-to-come,
105.9: the agreement that He made with Abraham, and His promise to Isaac.
105.10: He gave it to Jacob as a Law, to Israel as an agreement that will last forever.
105.11: He said, “I will give the land of Canaan to you as your share,”
105.12: when they were only a few men in number and were strangers in it.
105.13: They went from nation to nation, from the people under one king to the people under another.
105.14: He did not allow anyone to hold power over them. And He spoke sharp words to kings because of them.
105.15: He said, “Do not touch My chosen ones. And do not hurt those who speak for Me.”
105.16: Then He called for a time of no food on the land. He cut off all their bread.
105.17: He sent a man, Joseph, before them who was sold as a servant.
105.18: They hurt his feet with chains. He was put in irons,
105.19: until what he had said would happen came to pass. The Word of the Lord tested him.
105.20: The king sent and had him taken out of prison. The ruler of many people set him free.
105.21: He made him the lord of his house and ruler over all he had.
105.22: He could punish the rulers as he pleased. And he taught wisdom to the wise.
105.23: Then Israel also came into Egypt. So Jacob stayed in the land of Ham.
105.24: And He made the number of His people grow until they were stronger than those who held power over them.
105.25: He turned their hearts to hate His people and to make plans against His servants.
105.26: He sent Moses, His servant, and Aaron whom He had chosen.
105.27: They did His great works for them to see, powerful works in the land of Ham.
105.28: He sent darkness and made the land dark. They did not fight against what He told them to do.
105.29: He changed their water into blood, so their fish died.
105.30: Their land became covered with frogs, even in the rooms of their kings.
105.31: He spoke and there came many flies all over their land.
105.32: He gave them hail instead of rain, and lightning like fire in their land.
105.33: He destroyed their vines and fig trees and the trees of their country.
105.34: He spoke and the locusts came. There were too many to number.
105.35: They ate up all the plants in their country. They ate all the fruit of their land.
105.36: He killed all the first-born in their land, the first fruits of all their strength.
105.37: Then He brought Israel out with silver and gold. And there was not one weak person among their families.
105.38: Egypt was glad when they left. For they had become afraid of Israel.
105.39: He spread a cloud for a covering, and fire to give light at night.
105.40: They asked, and He brought them quails for meat. And He filled them with the bread of heaven.
105.41: He opened the rock and water flowed out. It flowed in the desert like a river.
105.42: For He remembered His holy Word with Abraham His servant.
105.43: And He brought His people out with joy, His chosen ones with singing.
105.44: He gave them the lands of the nations. They were given what others had worked for,
105.45: so that they might do what He told them and keep His Law. Praise the Lord!

106.1: Praise the Lord! O give thanks to the Lord for He is good. His loving-kindness lasts forever.
106.2: Who can put into words the great works of the Lord? Who can make known all His praise?
106.3: Happy are those who are faithful in being fair and who always do what is right and good!
106.4: O Lord, remember me when You show favor to Your people. Visit me also when You save them.
106.5: So I may share in the well-being of Your chosen ones. So I may share in the joy of Your nation, and be proud of Your people.
106.6: We have sinned like our fathers. We have done wrong. We have been sinful in our actions.
106.7: Our fathers in Egypt did not understand Your powerful works. They did not remember how many times You showed Your loving-kindness. But they turned against You by the sea, the Red Sea.
106.8: Yet He saved them because of the honor of His name, and to make His great power known.
106.9: So He spoke sharp words to the Red Sea and it dried up. And He led them through the sea as through a desert.
106.10: He saved them from the hand of those who hated them. He set them free from the hand of those who went against them.
106.11: And the waters covered those who hated them. Not one of them was left.
106.12: Then they believed His promises. They sang His praise.
106.13: But they soon forgot His works. They did not wait to hear what He wanted them to do.
106.14: They wanted many things in the desert, and they tempted God there.
106.15: So He gave them what they wanted, but He allowed their souls to become weak because of it.
106.16: They were jealous of Moses in the place where they set up their tents. And they were jealous of Aaron, the holy one of the Lord.
106.17: So the earth opened up and swallowed Dathan. It closed over the group of Abiram.
106.18: And a fire came among their followers. It burned up the sinful people.
106.19: They made a calf at Horeb and worshiped a god of gold.
106.20: They traded their shining-greatness for something that looked like a bull that eats grass.
106.21: They forgot the God Who saved them, Who had done great things in Egypt,
106.22: powerful works in the land of Ham, and works that brought fear by the Red Sea.
106.23: So He said that He would destroy them. But Moses, His chosen one, stood in the way to keep His anger from destroying them.
106.24: Then they hated the good land. They did not believe in His Word.
106.25: But they complained in their tents. They did not listen to the voice of the Lord.
106.26: So He swore to them that He would let them die in the desert.
106.27: And He would spread out their children among the nations and divide them over all the earth.
106.28: They joined themselves to Baal of Peor and ate gifts given to the dead.
106.29: They made the Lord angry by their actions and a sickness broke out among them.
106.30: Then Phinehas stood up and came between them, and the sickness was stopped.
106.31: And this made him right with God to all people forever.
106.32: They also made the Lord angry at the waters of Meribah. And trouble came to Moses because of them.
106.33: He spoke from his lips without thinking because they went against the Spirit of God.
106.34: They did not destroy the people as the Lord told them to do.
106.35: But they mixed with the nations and learned their ways.
106.36: They served their gods, which became a trap to them.
106.37: They even gave their sons and daughters as gifts on an altar to the demons.
106.38: They poured out the blood of those who were not guilty, the blood of their sons and daughters, whom they gave on an altar to the gods of Canaan. And the land was poisoned with blood.
106.39: They made themselves unclean by what they did. They were not true to God in what they did.
106.40: So the Lord was angry with His people. He hated His people.
106.41: So He handed them over to the nations. And those who hated them ruled over them.
106.42: Those who hated them held a strong power over them. And they were made to obey them.
106.43: God set them free many times. But they always turned against Him and went deeper into sin.
106.44: But He looked upon their trouble when He heard their cry.
106.45: He remembered His agreement because of them, and took pity on them by the greatness of His loving-kindness.
106.46: Those who held them also saw how God took pity on them.
106.47: O Lord our God, save us! Gather us from among the nations. And we will give thanks to Your holy name and find honor in Your praise.
106.48: Honor and thanks be to the Lord, the God of Israel, forever and ever. Let all the people say, “Let it be so!” Praise the Lord!

107.1: Give thanks to the Lord for He is good! His loving-kindness lasts forever!
107.2: Let the people who have been saved say so. He has bought them and set them free from the hand of those who hated them.
107.3: He gathered them from the lands, from east and west, from north and south.
107.4: Some traveled through the desert wastes. They did not find a way to a city where they could live.
107.5: They were hungry and thirsty. Their souls became weak within them.
107.6: Then they cried out to the Lord in their trouble. And He took them out of their suffering.
107.7: He led them by a straight path to a city where they could live.
107.8: Let them give thanks to the Lord for His loving-kindness and His great works to the children of men!
107.9: For He fills the thirsty soul. And He fills the hungry soul with good things.
107.10: Some sat in darkness and in the shadow of death. They suffered in prison in iron chains.
107.11: Because they had turned against the Words of God. They hated what the Most High told them to do.
107.12: So He loaded them down with hard work. They fell and there was no one to help.
107.13: Then they cried out to the Lord in their trouble. And He saved them from their suffering.
107.14: He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death. And He broke their chains.
107.15: Let them give thanks to the Lord for His loving-kindness and His great works to the children of men!
107.16: For He has broken gates of brass and cut through walls of iron.
107.17: Some were fools because of their wrong-doing. They had troubles because of their sins.
107.18: They hated all kinds of food. And they came near the gates of death.
107.19: Then they cried out to the Lord in their trouble. And He saved them from their suffering.
107.20: He sent His Word and healed them. And He saved them from the grave.
107.21: Let them give thanks to the Lord for His loving-kindness and His great works to the children of men!
107.22: Let them give Him gifts of thanks and tell of His works with songs of joy.
107.23: Some went out to sea in ships to buy and sell on the great waters.
107.24: They have seen what the Lord can do and His great works on the sea.
107.25: For He spoke and raised up a storm that lifted up the waves of the sea.
107.26: They went up to the heavens and down to the deep. Their strength of heart left them in their danger.
107.27: They could not walk straight but went from side to side like a drunk man. They did not know what to do.
107.28: Then they cried out to the Lord in their trouble. And He took them out of all their problems.
107.29: He stopped the storm, and the waves of the sea became quiet.
107.30: Then they were glad because the sea became quiet. And He led them to the safe place they wanted.
107.31: Let them give thanks to the Lord for His loving-kindness and His great works to the children of men!
107.32: Let them honor Him in the meeting of the people and praise Him in the meeting of the leaders.
107.33: He changes rivers into a desert and wells of water into a thirsty ground.
107.34: He changes a land of much fruit into a salt waste because of the sin of those who live in it.
107.35: He changes a desert into a pool of water and makes water flow out of dry ground.
107.36: And He makes the hungry go there so they may build a city to live in.
107.37: They plant seeds in the fields and plant grape-vines and gather much fruit.
107.38: He lets good come to them and they become many in number. And He does not let the number of their cattle become less.
107.39: When the number of people becomes less and they are put to shame under a bad power and trouble and sorrow,
107.40: He pours anger on rulers. He makes them walk in the waste places where there is no path.
107.41: But He lifts those in need out of their troubles. He makes their families grow like flocks.
107.42: Those who are right see it and are glad. But all the sinful shut their mouths.
107.43: Let the wise man think about these things. And may he think about the loving-kindness of the Lord.

108.1: My heart will not be moved, O God. I will sing. Yes, I will sing praises with my soul.
108.2: Wake up, different kinds of harps. I will wake up the new day.
108.3: I will give thanks to You among the people, O Lord. I will sing praises to You among the nations.
108.4: For Your loving-kindness is great above the heavens. And Your truth can touch the sky.
108.5: Be lifted up high above the heavens, O God. Let Your shining-greatness be over all the earth.
108.6: Save us with Your right hand and answer me. Let Your loved ones be set free.
108.7: God has said in His holy place: “I will be full of joy. I will divide Shechem and the valley of Succoth.
108.8: Gilead is Mine. Manasseh is Mine. Ephraim is the covering for My head. Judah is My law giver.
108.9: Moab is where I wash My hands. I will throw My shoe over Edom. I will call out over Philistia that I have won.”
108.10: Who will bring me into the strong city? Who will lead me into Edom?
108.11: Have You not turned away from us, O God? And will You not go out with our armies, O God?
108.12: O give us help against those who hate us. For the help of man is worth nothing.
108.13: With God’s help we will do great things. And He will break under His feet those who fight against us.

109.1: I give praise to You, O God. Do not be quiet.
109.2: For sinners and liars have opened their mouths against me. They have spoken against me with lying tongues.
109.3: They have gathered around me with words of hate. They fought against me for no reason.
109.4: I give them my love but they speak against me in return. But I am in prayer.
109.5: They pay me what is bad for what is good. They give me hate for my love.
109.6: Let a sinful man have power over him. Let one who speaks against him stand at his right hand.
109.7: When he is tried, let him be found guilty. And may his prayer become sin.
109.8: Let his days be few. Let another person take over his work.
109.9: Let his children be without a father. And let his wife be without a husband.
109.10: May his children go around begging. And may they look for food far from their destroyed homes.
109.11: Let the one to whom he owes money take all that he has. May strangers take away all he has worked for.
109.12: May no one show him kindness. Let no one pity his children who have no father.
109.13: Let his children be cut off. Do not let their family name be remembered by the people-to-come.
109.14: Let the sins of his fathers be remembered by the Lord, and do not let the sins of his mother be forgotten.
109.15: May these sins always be before the Lord. So He may not let them be remembered on the earth.
109.16: Because he did not remember to show loving-kindness. Instead he made it hard for the poor and those in need and those with a broken heart. He even put them to death.
109.17: He loved to curse others, so may it come to him. He did not like to have good come to others, so good was far from him.
109.18: He dressed himself with cursing as with a coat. They came into his body like water and into his bones like oil.
109.19: May they be like clothing that covers him and like a belt that he always wears.
109.20: Let this be what the Lord pays to those who speak against me and wish bad things would happen to me.
109.21: But You, O God, the Lord, be kind to me because of Your name. Take me out of trouble because Your loving-kindness is good.
109.22: For I am in trouble and in need. And my heart is hurt within me.
109.23: I am passing like an evening shadow. I am shaken off like a locust.
109.24: My knees are weak from going without food. And my body has lost all its fat.
109.25: Others laugh at me. They look at me and shake their heads.
109.26: Help me, O Lord my God! Save me by Your loving-kindness.
109.27: Let them know that this is Your hand and that You, O Lord, have done it.
109.28: Let them hope that bad things will happen. But You make good things happen. Let them be ashamed when they rise up against me. But let Your servant be full of joy.
109.29: Let those who speak against me be dressed with shame. Let them cover themselves with shame as with a coat.
109.30: I will give thanks to the Lord in a loud voice. I will praise Him among many people.
109.31: For He stands at the right hand of the one in need to save him from those who judge his soul.

110.1: The Lord says to my Lord, “Sit at My right side, for those who hate You will be a place to rest Your feet.”
110.2: The Lord will send out Your strength from Zion, saying, “Rule in front of those who hate You.”
110.3: Your people will be willing to help in the day of Your power. Your young men will be dressed in holy clothes. They will come to You like water on the grass in the early morning.
110.4: The Lord has sworn and will not change His mind: “You are a Religious Leader forever, in the same way as Melchizedek.”
110.5: The Lord is at Your right hand. He will crush kings in the day of His anger.
110.6: He will say who is guilty or not among the nations. He will fill them with dead bodies. He will crush the leaders of many lands.
110.7: He will drink from the river on the way. And so He will lift up His head.

111.1: Praise the Lord! I will give thanks to the Lord with all my heart where those who are right with God gather together and in the meeting of the people.
111.2: The works of the Lord are great. All who find joy in them try to understand them.
111.3: His work is great and powerful. And He is right and good forever.
111.4: He has made His great works to be remembered. The Lord shows loving-favor and pity.
111.5: He gives food to those who fear Him. He will remember His agreement forever.
111.6: He has shown His people the power of His works by giving them the land of other nations.
111.7: The works of His hands are faithful and right. All His Laws are true.
111.8: They stand strong forever and ever. They are done by what is true and right.
111.9: He has made a way for His people to be free. He has set up His agreement forever. His holy name is to be honored with fear.
111.10: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom. All who obey His Laws have good understanding. His praise lasts forever.

112.1: Praise the Lord! How happy is the man who honors the Lord with fear and finds joy in His Law!
112.2: His children will be powerful in the land. Each family who is right will be happy.
112.3: Riches and well-being are in his house. And his right-standing with God will last forever.
112.4: Light rises even in darkness for the one who is right. He is kind and has loving-pity and does what is right.
112.5: Good will come to the man who is ready to give much, and fair in what he does.
112.6: He will never be shaken. The man who is right and good will be remembered forever.
112.7: He will not be afraid of bad news. His heart is strong because he trusts in the Lord.
112.8: His heart will not be shaken. He will not be afraid and will watch those lose who fight against him.
112.9: He has given much to the poor. His right-standing with God lasts forever. His horn will be lifted high in honor.
112.10: The sinful man will see it and be troubled and angry. He will grind his teeth and waste away. The desire of the sinful will come to nothing.

113.1: Praise the Lord! Praise Him, O you who serve the Lord. Praise the name of the Lord.
113.2: Let the name of the Lord be honored, now and forever.
113.3: The name of the Lord is to be praised from the time the sun rises to when it sets.
113.4: The Lord is high above all nations. His shining-greatness is above the heavens.
113.5: Who is like the Lord our God? He sits on His throne on high.
113.6: He looks down upon the heavens and the earth.
113.7: He raises the poor from the dust. He lifts those in need from the ashes.
113.8: He makes them sit with rulers, with the rulers of His people.
113.9: He gives a home to the woman who could not give birth and makes her the mother of children. Praise the Lord!

114.1: Israel came out of Egypt. The house of Jacob came from a people who spoke a strange language.
114.2: Then Judah became His holy place, and Israel became the place of His rule.
114.3: The sea looked and ran away. The Jordan turned back.
114.4: The mountains jumped like sheep, the hills like lambs.
114.5: Why did you try to get away, O sea? Why did you turn back, O Jordan?
114.6: O mountains, why did you jump like sheep? O hills, why did you jump like lambs?
114.7: Shake in fear before the Lord, O earth, before the God of Jacob.
114.8: He changed the rock into a pool of water. He made water flow out of hard rock.

115.1: Let honor be given to Your name and not to us, O Lord, not to us. Because You are loving and kind and faithful.
115.2: Why should the nations say, “Where is their God now?”
115.3: But our God is in the heavens. He does whatever He wants to do.
115.4: Their gods are silver and gold, the work of human hands.
115.5: They have mouths but they cannot speak. They have eyes but they cannot see.
115.6: They have ears but they cannot hear. They have noses but they cannot smell.
115.7: They have hands but they cannot feel. They have feet but they cannot walk. They cannot make a sound come out of their mouths.
115.8: Those who make them and trust them will be like them.
115.9: O Israel, trust in the Lord. He is their help and safe-covering.
115.10: O house of Aaron, trust in the Lord. He is their help and safe-covering.
115.11: You who fear the Lord, trust in the Lord. He is their help and safe-covering.
115.12: The Lord has remembered us and will make good come to us. He will make good come to the house of Israel. He will make good come to the house of Aaron.
115.13: He will make good come to those who fear the Lord, both the small and the great.
115.14: May the Lord make your numbers grow, both you and your children.
115.15: May you be given good things by the Lord, the Maker of heaven and earth.
115.16: The heavens belong to the Lord. But He has given the earth to the children of men.
115.17: The dead do not praise the Lord. Neither do those who go down into the quiet place.
115.18: But we will give honor and thanks to the Lord, now and forever. Praise the Lord!

116.1: I love the Lord, because He hears my voice and my prayers.
116.2: I will call on Him as long as I live, because He has turned His ear to me.
116.3: The strings of death are all around me. And the fear of the grave came upon me. I suffered with trouble and sorrow.
116.4: Then I called on the name of the Lord: “O Lord, I beg You, save my life!”
116.5: The Lord is loving and right. Yes, our God is full of loving-kindness.
116.6: The Lord takes care of the child-like. I was brought down, and He saved me.
116.7: Return to your rest, O my soul. For the Lord has been good to you.
116.8: For You, O Lord, have saved my soul from death, my eyes from tears, and my feet from falling.
116.9: I will walk with the Lord in the land of the living.
116.10: I believed when I said, “I am very troubled.”
116.11: I said in my fear, “All men are liars.”
116.12: What should I give to the Lord for all the good things He has done for me?
116.13: I will show Him my thanks for saving me with a gift of wine and praise His name.
116.14: I will keep my promises to the Lord before all His people.
116.15: The death of His holy ones is of great worth in the eyes of the Lord.
116.16: For sure I am Your servant, O Lord. I am Your servant, the son of the woman who served You. You have set me free from my chains.
116.17: I will give a gift of thanks to You and call on the name of the Lord.
116.18: I will keep my promises to the Lord before all His people,
116.19: in the holy place of the Lord, and in the center of you, O Jerusalem. Praise the Lord!

117.1: Praise the Lord, all nations! Praise Him, all people!
117.2: For His loving-kindness toward us is great. And the truth of the Lord lasts forever. Praise the Lord!

118.1: Give thanks to the Lord, for He is good. His loving-kindness lasts forever.
118.2: Let Israel say, “His loving-kindness lasts forever.”
118.3: Let the house of Aaron say, “His loving-kindness lasts forever.”
118.4: Let those who fear the Lord say, “His loving-kindness lasts forever.”
118.5: I cried to the Lord in my trouble, and He answered me and put me in a good place.
118.6: The Lord is with me. I will not be afraid of what man can do to me.
118.7: The Lord is with me. He is my Helper. I will watch those lose who fight against me.
118.8: It is better to trust in the Lord than to trust in man.
118.9: It is better to trust in the Lord than to trust in rulers.
118.10: All nations gathered around me. But I cut them off in the name of the Lord.
118.11: They gathered around me. Yes, they were on every side. But I cut them off in the name of the Lord.
118.12: They were all around me like bees and they died out fast like burning thorns. I will destroy them in the name of the Lord.
118.13: You pushed me back so that I was falling, but the Lord helped me.
118.14: The Lord is my strength and my song. He is the One Who saves me.
118.15: The joy of being saved is being heard in the tents of those who are right and good. The right hand of the Lord does powerful things.
118.16: The Lord’s right hand is lifted high. The right hand of the Lord does powerful things.
118.17: I will not die but live. And I will tell of what the Lord has done.
118.18: The Lord has punished me but He has not given me over to death.
118.19: Open to me the gates of what is right and good. I will go through them and give thanks to the Lord.
118.20: This is the gate of the Lord. Those who are right with God will pass through it.
118.21: I will give thanks to You, for You have answered me. And You are the One Who saves me.
118.22: The stone that was put aside by the workmen has become the most important stone in the building.
118.23: The Lord has done this. We think it is great!
118.24: This is the day that the Lord has made. Let us be full of joy and be glad in it.
118.25: O Lord, we beg You to save us! O Lord, we ask that You let everything go well for us!
118.26: Great and honored is he who comes in the name of the Lord. We honor you from the house of the Lord.
118.27: The Lord is God. He has given us light. Tie the gift with rope to the horns of the altar on this special day.
118.28: You are my God and I will give You thanks. You are my God and I will praise You.
118.29: Give thanks to the Lord, for He is good. His loving-kindness lasts forever.

119.1: Happy are those whose way is without blame, who walk in the Law of the Lord.
119.2: Happy are those who keep His Law and look for Him with all their heart.
119.3: They also do not sin, but walk in His ways.
119.4: You have set down Laws that we should always obey.
119.5: O, that my ways may be always in keeping with Your Law!
119.6: Then I will not be put to shame when I respect Your Word.
119.7: I will praise You with a heart that is right when I learn how right You judge.
119.8: I will obey Your Law. Do not leave me all alone.
119.9: How can a young man keep his way pure? By living by Your Word.
119.10: I have looked for You with all my heart. Do not let me turn from Your Law.
119.11: Your Word have I hid in my heart, that I may not sin against You.
119.12: Great and honored are You, O Lord. Teach me Your Law.
119.13: I have told with my lips of all the Laws of Your mouth.
119.14: I have found as much joy in following Your Law as one finds in much riches.
119.15: I will think about Your Law and have respect for Your ways.
119.16: I will be glad in Your Law. I will not forget Your Word.
119.17: Do good to Your servant so I may live and obey Your Word.
119.18: Open my eyes so that I may see great things from Your Law.
119.19: I am a stranger on the earth. Do not hide Your Word from me.
119.20: My soul is crushed with a desire for Your Law at all times.
119.21: You speak sharp words to the proud, the hated ones, because they turn from Your Word.
119.22: Take away shame and bad feelings from me, for I have kept Your Law.
119.23: Even if rulers sit together and speak against me, Your servant thinks about Your Law.
119.24: Your Law is my joy and it tells me what to do.
119.25: My soul is laid in the dust. Give me new life because of Your Word.
119.26: I have told about my ways, and You have answered me. Teach me Your Law.
119.27: Make me understand the way of Your Law so I will talk about Your great works.
119.28: My soul cries because of sorrow. Give me strength because of Your Word.
119.29: Take the false way from me. Show Your loving-favor by giving me Your Law.
119.30: I have chosen the faithful way. I have set Your Law in front of me.
119.31: I hold on to Your Law, O Lord. Do not put me to shame.
119.32: I will run the way of Your Law, for You will give me a willing heart.
119.33: O Lord, teach me the way of Your Law and I will obey it to the end.
119.34: Give me understanding. Then I will listen to Your Word and obey it with all my heart.
119.35: Make me walk in the path of Your Word, for I find joy in it.
119.36: Turn my heart toward Your Law, so I will not earn money in a wrong way.
119.37: Turn my eyes away from things that have no worth, and give me new life because of Your ways.
119.38: Keep Your promise to Your servant, the promise You made to those who fear and worship You.
119.39: Turn away the shame that I do not want to come to me, for Your Law is good.
119.40: O, how I desire Your Law! Give me new life because of Your right and good way.
119.41: May Your loving-kindness also come to me, O Lord. May You save me as Your Word says.
119.42: Then I will have an answer for the one who puts me to shame, for I trust in Your Word.
119.43: Do not take the word of truth out of my mouth, for I hope in Your Law.
119.44: I will always obey Your Law, forever and ever.
119.45: I will walk as a free man, for I look for Your Law.
119.46: I will speak of Your Law in front of kings and will not be ashamed.
119.47: I will be glad in Your Law, which I love.
119.48: I will lift up my hands to Your Word, which I love, and I will think about Your Law.
119.49: Remember Your Word to Your servant, for You have given me hope.
119.50: Your Word has given me new life. This is my comfort in my suffering.
119.51: The proud always laugh at me, but I do not turn away from Your Law.
119.52: I have remembered Your Law from a long time ago, O Lord, and I am comforted.
119.53: Burning anger comes upon me because of the sinful who turn away from Your Law.
119.54: Your Laws are my songs in whatever house I stay.
119.55: I remember Your name in the night, O Lord, and I have kept Your Law.
119.56: It has become my way to obey Your Law.
119.57: The Lord is my share. I have promised to obey Your Word.
119.58: I begged for Your favor with all my heart. Show me Your love because of Your Word.
119.59: I thought about my ways and turned my steps to Your Law.
119.60: I hurried and did not wait to obey Your Law.
119.61: The ropes of the sinful are all around me, but I have not forgotten Your Law.
119.62: I will rise late in the night to give thanks to You because Your Law is right and good.
119.63: I am a friend to all who fear You and of those who keep Your Law.
119.64: The earth is full of Your loving-kindness, O Lord. Teach me Your Law.
119.65: You have done good to Your servant, O Lord, because of Your Word.
119.66: Teach me what I should know to be right and fair for I believe in Your Law.
119.67: Before I suffered I went the wrong way, but now I obey Your Word.
119.68: You are good and You do good. Teach me Your Law.
119.69: The proud have put together a lie against me. I will keep Your Law with all my heart.
119.70: Their heart is covered with fat, but I find joy in Your Law.
119.71: It is good for me that I was troubled, so that I might learn Your Law.
119.72: The Law of Your mouth is better to me than thousands of gold and silver pieces.
119.73: Your hands made me and put me together. Give me understanding to learn Your Law.
119.74: May those who fear You see me and be glad, for I have put my hope in Your Word.
119.75: O Lord, I know that what You decide is right and good. You punish me because You are faithful.
119.76: May Your loving-kindness comfort me because of Your promise to Your servant.
119.77: Let Your loving-pity come to me so I may live. For Your Law is my joy.
119.78: May the proud be ashamed, because they do wrong to me for no reason, but I will think about Your Law.
119.79: May those who fear You and those who know Your Law turn to me.
119.80: Let my heart be without blame in Your Law. Do not let me be put to shame.
119.81: My soul becomes weak with desire for Your saving power, but I have put my hope in Your Word.
119.82: My eyes become weak with desire for Your Word. I say, “When will You comfort me?”
119.83: I have become like a wineskin in the smoke, but I do not forget Your Law.
119.84: How long must Your servant wait? When will You punish those who make it hard for me?
119.85: The proud have dug deep holes for me. They do not obey Your Law.
119.86: All of Your Word is faithful. Help me! For they have made it hard for me with a lie.
119.87: They almost destroyed me on the earth, but I did not turn away from Your Law.
119.88: Give me life again by Your loving-kindness, and I will keep the Word of Your mouth.
119.89: Forever, O Lord, Your Word will never change in heaven.
119.90: You are faithful to all people for all time. You have made the earth, and it stands.
119.91: They stand today by Your Law, for all things serve You.
119.92: I would have been lost in my troubles if Your Law had not been my joy.
119.93: I will never forget Your Word for by it You have given me new life.
119.94: I am Yours. Save me, for I have looked to Your Law.
119.95: The sinful wait to destroy me, but I will think about Your Word.
119.96: I have seen that all things have an end, even if they are perfect, but Your Word is without end.
119.97: O, how I love Your Law! It is what I think about all through the day.
119.98: Your Word makes me wiser than those who hate me, for it is always with me.
119.99: I have better understanding than all my teachers because I think about Your Law.
119.100: I have a better understanding than those who are old because I obey Your Word.
119.101: I have kept my feet from every sinful way so that I may keep Your Word.
119.102: I have not turned away from Your Law, for You Yourself have taught me.
119.103: How sweet is Your Word to my taste! It is sweeter than honey to my mouth!
119.104: I get understanding from Your Law and so I hate every false way.
119.105: Your Word is a lamp to my feet and a light to my path.
119.106: I have promised that I will keep Your Law. And I will add strength to this promise.
119.107: I am in much suffering. O Lord, give me life again by Your Word.
119.108: Take my willing gift of thanks, O Lord, and teach me Your Law.
119.109: My life is always in my hand, yet I do not forget Your Law.
119.110: The sinful have set a trap for me, yet I have not turned from Your Law.
119.111: I have been given Your Law forever. It is the joy of my heart.
119.112: I have set my heart on obeying Your Law forever, even to the end.
119.113: I hate those who have two ways of thinking, but I love Your Law.
119.114: You are my hiding place and my battle-covering. I put my hope in Your Word.
119.115: Go away from me, you who do wrong, so I may keep the Word of my God.
119.116: Hold me up by Your Word and I will live. Do not let me be ashamed of my hope.
119.117: Hold me up so I will be safe, and I will always have respect for Your Law.
119.118: You turn away from all those who turn from Your Law. They fool themselves with their own lying.
119.119: You put away like waste all the sinful of the earth, so I love Your Law.
119.120: My flesh shakes in fear of You, and I am afraid of how You may punish.
119.121: I have done what is fair and right. Do not leave me to those who would make it hard for me.
119.122: Promise that You will bring good to Your servant. Do not let the proud make it hard for me.
119.123: My eyes become weak with desire for Your saving power and for Your Word that is right and good.
119.124: Act in Your loving-kindness toward Your servant, and teach me Your Laws.
119.125: I am Your servant. Give me understanding so I may know Your Law.
119.126: It is time for You to work, Lord, for they have broken Your Law.
119.127: I love Your Word more than gold, more than pure gold.
119.128: And so I look upon all of Your Law as right. I hate every false way.
119.129: Your Laws are wonderful, and so I obey them.
119.130: The opening up of Your Word gives light. It gives understanding to the child-like.
119.131: I opened my mouth wide, breathing with desire for Your Law.
119.132: Turn to me and show me loving-favor, as You always do to those who love Your name.
119.133: Set my steps in Your Word. Do not let sin rule over me.
119.134: Set me free from the power of man, and I will obey Your Law.
119.135: Make Your face shine upon Your servant and teach me Your Law.
119.136: Tears flow from my eyes because of those who do not keep Your Law.
119.137: You are right and good, O Lord, and Your Law is right.
119.138: The Law You have made is right and good and very faithful.
119.139: I feel weak because those who hate me have forgotten Your Word.
119.140: Your Word is very pure and Your servant loves it.
119.141: I am not important and I am hated but I do not forget Your Law.
119.142: You are right forever, and Your Law is truth.
119.143: Trouble and suffering have come upon me, yet Your Word is my joy.
119.144: Your Law is right forever. Give me understanding and I will live.
119.145: I cried with all my heart. Answer me, O Lord! I will keep Your Law.
119.146: I cried to You. Save me, and I will keep Your Word.
119.147: I rise before the morning comes and cry for help. I have put my hope in Your Word.
119.148: My eyes wait for the night hours, so I may think about Your Word.
119.149: Hear my voice because of Your loving-kindness. O Lord, give me new life again because of Your Law.
119.150: Those who follow sinful ways come near. But they are far from Your Law.
119.151: You are near, O Lord. And all of Your Word is truth.
119.152: I learned from Your Law long ago that You made it to last forever.
119.153: Look upon my suffering and take me from it. For I do not forget Your Law.
119.154: Stand by me and set me free. Give me life again because of Your Word.
119.155: Your saving help is far from the sinful, for they do not look to Your Law.
119.156: Your loving-kindness is great, O Lord. Give me life again because of Your Law.
119.157: There are many who hate me and make it hard for me. Yet I do not turn from Your Law.
119.158: I look with hate on those who cannot be trusted, because they do not keep Your Word.
119.159: Think about how I love Your Law. Give me life again, O Lord, because of Your loving-kindness.
119.160: All of Your Word is truth, and every one of Your laws, which are always right, will last forever.
119.161: Rulers make it hard for me for no reason, but my heart honors Your Words with fear.
119.162: I am made happy by Your Word, like one who finds great riches.
119.163: I hate what is false, but I love Your Law.
119.164: I praise You seven times a day, because Your Law is right.
119.165: Those who love Your Law have great peace, and nothing will cause them to be hurt in their spirit.
119.166: I hope for Your saving power, O Lord, and I follow Your Word.
119.167: I obey Your Law, for I love it very much.
119.168: I obey Your Word and Laws, for You know all my ways.
119.169: Let my cry come to You, O Lord. Give me understanding because of Your Word.
119.170: Let my prayer come to You. Help me because of Your Word.
119.171: May praise come from my lips, for You teach me Your Law.
119.172: May my tongue sing about Your Word, for all of Your Word is right and good.
119.173: May Your hand be ready to help me, for I have chosen Your Law.
119.174: I have much desire for Your saving power, O Lord. Your Law is my joy.
119.175: Let me live so I may praise You, and let Your Law help me.
119.176: I have gone from the way like a lost sheep. Look for Your servant, for I do not forget Your Word.

120.1: I cried to the Lord in my trouble, and He answered me.
120.2: O Lord, save me from lying lips and a false tongue.
120.3: What will be given to you and what more will be done to you, you false tongue?
120.4: He will punish you with sharp arrows of the soldier, and with the hot fire of the broom tree.
120.5: It is bad for me, for I travel in Meshech and live among the tents of Kedar!
120.6: I have lived too long with those who hate peace.
120.7: I am for peace. But when I speak, they are for war.

121.1: I will lift up my eyes to the mountains. Where will my help come from?
121.2: My help comes from the Lord, Who made heaven and earth.
121.3: He will not let your feet go out from under you. He Who watches over you will not sleep.
121.4: Listen, He Who watches over Israel will not close his eyes or sleep.
121.5: The Lord watches over you. The Lord is your safe cover at your right hand.
121.6: The sun will not hurt you during the day and the moon will not hurt you during the night.
121.7: The Lord will keep you from all that is sinful. He will watch over your soul.
121.8: The Lord will watch over your coming and going, now and forever.

122.1: I was glad when they said to me, “Let us go to the house of the Lord.”
122.2: Our feet are standing inside your gates, O Jerusalem.
122.3: Jerusalem is built as a city where people come together.
122.4: That is where the different families go, the families of the Lord. There they give thanks to the name of the Lord, by the Law that was given to Israel.
122.5: For thrones were set there for telling who is guilty or not, the thrones of the house of David.
122.6: Pray for the peace of Jerusalem. May all go well for those who love you.
122.7: May there be peace within your walls. May all go well within your houses.
122.8: I will now say, “May peace be within you,” for the good of my brothers and my friends.
122.9: Because of the house of the Lord our God, I will pray for your good.

123.1: I lift up my eyes to You, O You Whose throne is in the heavens.
123.2: See, the eyes of servants look to the hand of their owner. The eyes of a woman servant look to the hand of her owner. So our eyes look to the Lord our God, until He shows us loving-kindness.
123.3: Show loving-kindness to us, O Lord. Show loving-kindness to us. For we have had our fill of hate.
123.4: The proud have laughed at us too long. We have had more than enough of their hate.

124.1: “If the Lord had not been on our side,” let Israel say,
124.2: “If the Lord had not been on our side when men came against us,
124.3: they would have eaten us up alive. Because their anger burned against us.
124.4: The waters would have covered us. The river would have passed over our soul.
124.5: The angry waters would have passed over our soul.”
124.6: Honor and thanks be to the Lord! He has not let us be torn by their teeth.
124.7: We have become free like a bird out of a trap. The net is broken and now we are free.
124.8: Our help is in the name of the Lord, Who made heaven and earth.

125.1: Those who trust in the Lord are like Mount Zion, which cannot be moved but stands forever.
125.2: The Lord is around His people like the mountains are around Jerusalem, now and forever.
125.3: For the sinful will not rule over the land of those who are right with God. So those who are right and good may not use their hands to do wrong.
125.4: O Lord, do good to those who are good, and to those who are right in their hearts.
125.5: But the Lord will let all those who turn aside to their sinful ways go with those who are sinners. Peace be upon Israel.

126.1: It was like a dream when the Lord brought back to Zion those who had been held in another land.
126.2: Then we laughed with our mouths, and we sang with our tongues. Then it was said among the nations, “The Lord has done great things for them.”
126.3: The Lord has done great things for us and we are glad.
126.4: Bring back our people, O Lord, like the rivers in the South.
126.5: Those who plant with tears will gather fruit with songs of joy.
126.6: He who goes out crying as he carries his bag of seed will return with songs of joy as he brings much grain with him.

127.1: Unless the Lord builds the house, its builders work for nothing. Unless the Lord watches over the city, the men who watch over it stay awake for nothing.
127.2: You rise up early, and go to bed late, and work hard for your food, all for nothing. For the Lord gives to His loved ones even while they sleep.
127.3: See, children are a gift from the Lord. The children born to us are our special reward.
127.4: The children of a young man are like arrows in the hand of a soldier.
127.5: Happy is the man who has many of them. They will not be put to shame when they speak in the gate with those who hate them.

128.1: Happy are all who honor the Lord with fear, and who walk in His ways.
128.2: For you will eat the fruit of your hands. You will be happy and it will be well with you.
128.3: Your wife will be like a vine with much fruit within your house. Your children will be like olive plants around your table.
128.4: This is the good that will come to the man who honors the Lord with fear.
128.5: May the Lord do good things for you from Zion. And may you see good come to Jerusalem all the days of your life.
128.6: Yes, may you see your children’s children. Peace be upon Israel.

129.1: “They have made it hard for me many times since I was young,” let Israel now say.
129.2: “They have made it hard for me many times since I was young. But they have not won over me.
129.3: Those who plow have plowed my back. And they have made their ditches long.”
129.4: The Lord is right and good. He has cut in two the ropes of the sinful.
129.5: May all who hate Zion be put to shame and turned away.
129.6: Let them be like grass on the roof, which dries up before it grows.
129.7: No one can pick it and fill his hand. No one can gather it and fill his arms.
129.8: And those who pass by do not say, “May the Lord be good to you. We pray that good will come to you in the name of the Lord.”

130.1: O Lord, I have cried to You out of the deep places.
130.2: Lord, hear my voice! Let Your ears hear the voice of my prayers.
130.3: If you, Lord, should write down our sins, O Lord, who could stand?
130.4: But You are the One Who forgives, so You are honored with fear.
130.5: I wait for the Lord. My soul waits and I hope in His Word.
130.6: My soul waits for the Lord more than one who watches for the morning; yes, more than one who watches for the morning.
130.7: O Israel, hope in the Lord! For there is loving-kindness with the Lord. With Him we are saved for sure.
130.8: And He will save Israel from all their sins.

131.1: O Lord, my heart is not proud. My eyes are not filled with pride. And I do not trouble myself with important things or in things too great for me.
131.2: For sure I have made my soul quiet like a child who no longer nurses while he is with his mother. My soul within me is like a child who no longer nurses.
131.3: O Israel, hope in the Lord, now and forever.

132.1: O Lord, remember David and all of his suffering.
132.2: Remember how he swore to the Lord, and how he made a promise to the Powerful One of Jacob:
132.3: “For sure I will not go into my house or lie on my bed,
132.4: or let sleep come and close my eyes,
132.5: until I find a place for the Lord, a house of worship for the Powerful One of Jacob.”
132.6: See, we heard about it in Ephrathah. We found it in the field of Jaar.
132.7: Let us go into the House of God. Let us worship at His feet.
132.8: Rise up, O Lord. Go to the place where You can rest, You and the special box of the Way of Worship which is Your strength.
132.9: Let Your religious leaders be dressed with what is right and good. And let those who belong to You sing for joy.
132.10: Because of David Your servant, do not turn away from Your chosen one.
132.11: The Lord has made a sure promise to David that He will never break: “I will set upon your throne your own children.
132.12: If your sons will keep My Law and My Word which I will teach them, then their sons will sit upon your throne forever.”
132.13: For the Lord has chosen Zion. He has wanted it for a place to live:
132.14: “This is the place where I can rest forever. Here I will live, for I have wanted it.
132.15: I will give her many good things. I will give her poor people much bread.
132.16: I will dress her religious leaders with saving power. And those in her that belong to Me will sing for joy.
132.17: There I will make the horn of David grow and will make a lamp ready for My chosen one.
132.18: I will dress those who hate him with shame. But the crown on him will shine.”

133.1: See, how good and how pleasing it is for brothers to live together as one!
133.2: It is like oil of great worth poured on the head, flowing down through the hair on the face, even the face of Aaron, and flowing down to his coat.
133.3: It is like the morning water of Hermon coming down upon the hills of Zion. For there the Lord has given the gift of life that lasts forever.

134.1: See, give honor and thanks to the Lord, all who work for the Lord, who stand during the night in the house of the Lord.
134.2: Lift up your hands to the holy place and give thanks to the Lord.
134.3: May the Lord bring good to you from Zion. He is the One Who made heaven and earth.

135.1: Praise the Lord! Praise the name of the Lord! Praise Him, O servants of the Lord,
135.2: you who stand in the house of the Lord, within the walls of the house of our God.
135.3: Praise the Lord, for the Lord is good. Sing praises to His name, for it is sweet.
135.4: For the Lord has chosen Jacob for Himself. Israel belongs to Him.
135.5: I know that the Lord is great. He is greater than all gods.
135.6: The Lord does whatever is pleasing to Him, in heaven and on earth, in the seas and in all waters.
135.7: He makes the clouds rise from the ends of the earth. He makes lightning come with the rain. He brings the wind out from where He stores His riches.
135.8: He killed the first-born of Egypt, both man and animal.
135.9: He sent special things to see and did great works among you, O Egypt, against Pharaoh and all his servants.
135.10: He crushed many nations and killed powerful kings,
135.11: King Sihon of the Amorites, King Og of Bashan, and all the kings of Canaan.
135.12: And He gave their land as a gift, a gift to Israel His people.
135.13: O Lord, Your name lasts forever. O Lord, You will be remembered for all time.
135.14: For the Lord will decide in favor of His people. He will have loving-pity on His servants.
135.15: The gods of the nations are silver and gold, made by the hands of men.
135.16: They have mouths but they do not speak. They have eyes but they do not see.
135.17: They have ears but they do not hear. And there is no breath in their mouths.
135.18: Those who make them and those who trust in them will be like them.
135.19: O house of Israel, give honor and thanks to the Lord. O house of Aaron, give honor and thanks to the Lord.
135.20: O house of Levi, give honor and thanks to the Lord. You who fear the Lord, give honor and thanks to the Lord.
135.21: Honor and thanks be to the Lord from Zion, Who lives in Jerusalem. Praise the Lord!

136.1: Give thanks to the Lord, for He is good, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
136.2: Give thanks to the God of gods, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
136.3: Give thanks to the Lord of lords, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
136.4: Give thanks to Him Who alone does great works, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
136.5: Give thanks to Him Who by wisdom made the heavens, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
136.6: Give thanks to Him Who spread out the earth upon the waters, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
136.7: Give thanks to Him Who made the great lights, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
136.8: He made the sun to rule during the day, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
136.9: He made the moon and stars to rule during the night, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
136.10: Give thanks to Him Who killed the first-born of Egypt, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
136.11: He brought Israel out from among them, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
136.12: He put out His arm and brought them out with a strong hand, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
136.13: Give thanks to Him Who divided the Red Sea in two, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
136.14: He led Israel through, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
136.15: But He caused the death of Pharaoh and his army in the Red Sea, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
136.16: Give thanks to Him Who led His people through the desert, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
136.17: Give thanks to Him Who destroyed great kings, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
136.18: He killed powerful kings, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
136.19: He put to death Sihon, king of the Amorites, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
136.20: He put to death Og, king of Bashan, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
136.21: He gave their land as a gift, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
136.22: He gave it as a gift to Israel His servant, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
136.23: Give thanks to Him Who remembered us when we had nothing, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
136.24: He took us away from those who hated us, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
136.25: He gives food to all men, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.
136.26: Give thanks to the God of heaven, for His loving-kindness lasts forever.

137.1: We sat down and cried by the rivers of Babylon when we remembered Zion.
137.2: There upon the trees we put our harps.
137.3: For those who held us there made us sing. And those who made it hard for us asked for joy. They said, “Sing us one of the songs of Zion.”
137.4: How can we sing the song of the Lord in a strange land?
137.5: If I forget you, O Jerusalem, may my right hand forget what it is able to do.
137.6: May my tongue hold to the roof of my mouth if I do not remember you, if I do not honor Jerusalem above my highest joy.
137.7: O Lord, remember what the sons of Edom did on the day Jerusalem fell. “Knock it down,” they said, “Knock it down to the ground.”
137.8: O daughter of Babylon, you who will be destroyed, how honored will be the one who pays you back for what you have done to us!
137.9: How honored will be the one who catches your children and throws them against the rock!

138.1: I will give You thanks with all my heart. I will sing praises to You in front of the gods.
138.2: I will bow down toward Your holy house. And I will give thanks to Your name for Your loving-kindness and Your truth. For You have honored Your Word because of what Your name is.
138.3: You answered me on the day I called. You gave me strength in my soul.
138.4: O Lord, all the kings of the earth will give thanks to You when they have heard the words of Your mouth.
138.5: And they will sing of the ways of the Lord. For the shining beauty of the Lord is great.
138.6: For even if the Lord is honored, He thinks about those who have no pride. But He knows the proud from far away.
138.7: Even if I walk into trouble, You will keep my life safe. You will put out Your hand against the anger of those who hate me. And Your right hand will save me.
138.8: The Lord will finish the work He started for me. O Lord, Your loving-kindness lasts forever. Do not turn away from the works of Your hands.

139.1: O Lord, You have looked through me and have known me.
139.2: You know when I sit down and when I get up. You understand my thoughts from far away.
139.3: You look over my path and my lying down. You know all my ways very well.
139.4: Even before I speak a word, O Lord, You know it all.
139.5: You have closed me in from behind and in front. And You have laid Your hand upon me.
139.6: All You know is too great for me. It is too much for me to understand.
139.7: Where can I go from Your Spirit? Or where can I run away from where You are?
139.8: If I go up to heaven, You are there! If I make my bed in the place of the dead, You are there!
139.9: If I take the wings of the morning or live in the farthest part of the sea,
139.10: even there Your hand will lead me and Your right hand will hold me.
139.11: If I say, “For sure the darkness will cover me and the light around me will be night,”
139.12: even the darkness is not dark to You. And the night is as bright as the day. Darkness and light are the same to You.
139.13: For You made the parts inside me. You put me together inside my mother.
139.14: I will give thanks to You, for the greatness of the way I was made brings fear. Your works are great and my soul knows it very well.
139.15: My bones were not hidden from You when I was made in secret and put together with care in the deep part of the earth.
139.16: Your eyes saw me before I was put together. And all the days of my life were written in Your book before any of them came to be.
139.17: Your thoughts are of great worth to me, O God. How many there are!
139.18: If I could number them, there would be more than the sand. When I awake, I am still with You.
139.19: If only You would kill the sinful, O God, and the men of blood would go away from me!
139.20: For they speak against You in sin. Those who hate You use Your name in a wrong way.
139.21: Do I not hate those who hate You, O Lord? And do I not hate those who rise up against You?
139.22: I hate them with the strongest hate. They have become men who hate me.
139.23: Look through me, O God, and know my heart. Try me and know my thoughts.
139.24: See if there is any sinful way in me and lead me in the way that lasts forever.

140.1: O Lord, take me away from sinful men. Keep me safe from men who want to hurt others.
140.2: They make sinful plans in their hearts. They always start wars.
140.3: They make their tongues sharp like a snake’s. And the poison of a snake is under their lips.
140.4: O Lord, keep me from the hands of the sinful. Keep me safe from men who want to hurt others and have planned to trip my feet.
140.5: The proud have hidden a trap for me. With ropes they have spread a net. They have set traps for me beside the road.
140.6: I said to the Lord, “You are my God. Listen to the voice of my prayers, O Lord.
140.7: O God the Lord, the strength that saves me, You have covered my head in the day of battle.
140.8: O Lord, do not give the sinful what they want. Do not let their plans work, or they will be honored.
140.9: “As for those who gather around me, may the wrong-doing of their lips come upon their heads.
140.10: May burning coals fall upon them. May they be thrown into the fire, into deep holes, and rise no more.
140.11: Do not let the man whose talking hurts people stand in the land. May trouble hurry to catch and destroy the man who wants to hurt others.”
140.12: I know that the Lord will stand by those who suffer and do what is right for the poor.
140.13: For sure those who are right and good will give thanks to Your name. Those who are right will live with You.

141.1: I call upon You, O Lord. Hurry to me! Hear my voice when I call to You!
141.2: May my prayer be like special perfume before You. May the lifting up of my hands be like the evening gift given on the altar in worship.
141.3: O Lord, put a watch over my mouth. Keep watch over the door of my lips.
141.4: Do not let my heart turn to any sinful thing, to do wrong with men who sin. And do not let me eat their fine food.
141.5: Let those who are right with God punish me and speak strong words to me in kindness. It is oil upon my head. Do not let my head turn away from it. Yet my prayer is always against the sinful works of those who sin.
141.6: When their rulers are thrown down from high rocks, they will hear my words, for they are true.
141.7: Our bones have been spread around the mouth of the grave like the broken ground behind the plow.
141.8: For my eyes are toward You, O God the Lord. In You I have a safe place. Do not leave me without help.
141.9: Keep me from the trap they have set for me. Keep me from the nets of those who do wrong.
141.10: Let the sinful fall into their own nets, while I pass by and am safe.

142.1: I cry with a loud voice to the Lord. I pray with my voice to the Lord.
142.2: I talk and complain to Him. I tell Him all my trouble.
142.3: When my spirit had grown weak within me, You knew my path. They have hidden a trap for me in the way where I walk.
142.4: Look to the right and see. For there is no one who thinks about me. There is no place for me to go to be safe. No one cares about my soul.
142.5: I cried out to You, O Lord. I said, “You are my safe place, my share in the land of the living.
142.6: Listen to my cry, for I am brought down. Save me from those who make it hard for me. For they are too strong for me.
142.7: Bring my soul out of prison, so that I may give thanks to Your name. Those who are right and good will gather around me. For You will give much to me.”

143.1: Hear my prayer, O Lord. Listen when I ask for help. Answer me because You are faithful and right.
143.2: Do not find Your servant guilty, for no man living is right and good in Your eyes.
143.3: For the one who hates me has made it hard for my soul. He has crushed my life to the ground. He has made me live in dark places, like those who have been dead for a long time.
143.4: So my spirit grows weak within me. My heart within me is afraid.
143.5: I remember the days long ago. I think about all You have done. I think about the work of Your hands.
143.6: I put out my hands to You. My soul is thirsty for You like a dry land.
143.7: Hurry to answer me, O Lord! My spirit is becoming weak! Do not hide Your face from me, or I will become like those who go down to the grave.
143.8: Let me hear Your loving-kindness in the morning, for I trust in You. Teach me the way I should go for I lift up my soul to You.
143.9: O Lord, take me away from those who hate me. I run to You to be safe.
143.10: Teach me to do Your will, for You are my God. Let Your good Spirit lead me on a straight path.
143.11: Give me new life, O Lord, because of Your name. Bring me out of trouble because You are right and good.
143.12: In Your loving-kindness cut off those who hate me. Destroy all those who make it hard for my soul, for I am Your servant.

144.1: Praise and thanks be to the Lord, my rock. He makes my hands ready for war, and my fingers for battle.
144.2: He is my loving-kindness and my walls of strength, my strong place and the One Who sets me free, my safe-covering and the One in Whom I trust. He brings my people under my rule.
144.3: O Lord, what is man that You think of him, the son of man that You remember him?
144.4: Man is like a breath. His days are like a passing shadow.
144.5: O Lord, divide Your heavens and come down. Touch the mountains so they will smoke.
144.6: Send out lightning and divide them. Send out Your arrows and trouble them.
144.7: Put out Your hand from above. Take me out of trouble and away from the many waters, from the power of those from other lands.
144.8: Their mouths speak lies. And their right hand is a right hand that is false.
144.9: I will sing a new song to You, O God. I will sing praises to You on a harp of ten strings.
144.10: You save kings. You take Your servant David away from the sharp sword.
144.11: Take me out of trouble and away from the power of those from other lands. Their mouths speak lies. And their right hand is a right hand that is false.
144.12: May our young sons be like plants that are full-grown. And may our daughters be like the corner pieces of a great house.
144.13: May our store-houses be full of all kinds of food. And may our sheep grow by the thousands and ten thousands in our fields.
144.14: Let our cattle give birth without trouble and without loss. And may there be no cry of trouble in our streets.
144.15: Happy are the people who have all this. Yes, happy are the people whose God is the Lord!

145.1: I will praise You, my God and King. I will honor Your name forever and ever.
145.2: I will honor You every day, and praise Your name forever and ever.
145.3: The Lord is great and our praise to Him should be great. He is too great for anyone to understand.
145.4: Families of this time will praise Your works to the families-to-come. They will tell about Your powerful acts.
145.5: I will think about the shining-greatness of Your power and about Your great works.
145.6: Men will speak of Your powerful acts that fill us with fear. And I will tell of Your greatness.
145.7: Many words will come from their mouths about how good You are. They will sing for joy about how right You are.
145.8: The Lord is full of loving-favor and pity, slow to anger and great in loving-kindness.
145.9: The Lord is good to all. And His loving-kindness is over all His works.
145.10: All Your works will give thanks to You, O Lord. And all those who belong to You will honor You.
145.11: They will speak of the shining-greatness of Your holy nation, and talk of Your power.
145.12: They will make Your powerful acts and the great power of Your holy nation known to the sons of men.
145.13: Your holy nation is a nation that lasts forever. And Your rule lasts for all time.
145.14: The Lord holds up all who fall. He raises up all who are brought down.
145.15: The eyes of all look to You. And You give them their food at the right time.
145.16: You open Your hand and fill the desire of every living thing.
145.17: The Lord is right and good in all His ways, and kind in all His works.
145.18: The Lord is near to all who call on Him, to all who call on Him in truth.
145.19: He will fill the desire of those who fear Him. He will also hear their cry and will save them.
145.20: The Lord takes care of all who love Him. But He will destroy all the sinful.
145.21: My mouth will speak the praise of the Lord. And all flesh will honor His holy name forever and ever.

146.1: Praise the Lord! Praise the Lord, O my soul!
146.2: I will praise the Lord as long as I live. I will sing praises to my God as long as I live.
146.3: Do not put your trust in princes, in a son of a man, who cannot save us.
146.4: When his spirit leaves, he returns to the earth. His thoughts end on that day.
146.5: Happy is he whose help is the God of Jacob, and whose hope is in the Lord his God.
146.6: The Lord made heaven and earth, the sea and all that is in them. He is faithful forever.
146.7: He helps those who have a bad power over them. He gives food to the hungry. And He sets those in prison free.
146.8: The Lord opens the eyes of the blind. The Lord raises up those who are brought down. The Lord loves those who are right and good.
146.9: The Lord keeps the strangers safe. He takes care of the children who have no father and the woman whose husband has died. But He destroys the way of the sinful.
146.10: The Lord will rule forever. Your God, O Zion, will rule over all people for all time. Praise the Lord!

147.1: Praise the Lord! For it is good to sing praises to our God. For it is pleasing and praise is right.
147.2: The Lord builds up Jerusalem. He gathers those of Israel who had been taken away.
147.3: He heals those who have a broken heart. He heals their sorrows.
147.4: He knows the number of the stars. He gives names to all of them.
147.5: Great is our Lord, and great in power. His understanding has no end.
147.6: The Lord lifts up those who are suffering, and He brings the sinful down to the ground.
147.7: Sing to the Lord with thanks. Sing praises to our God on the harp.
147.8: He covers the heavens with clouds. He gives rain for the earth. He makes grass grow on the mountains.
147.9: He gives food to the animals, and to the young ravens that cry.
147.10: His joy is not in the strength of a horse. He does not find joy in the legs of a man.
147.11: But the Lord favors those who fear Him and those who wait for His loving-kindness.
147.12: Praise the Lord, O Jerusalem! Praise your God, O Zion!
147.13: For He has made your gates strong. He has made good come to your children within you.
147.14: He makes peace within your walls. He fills you with the best grain.
147.15: He sends His Word to the earth. And His Word runs fast.
147.16: He gives snow like wool. He spreads ice like ashes.
147.17: He throws down His ice as hail stones. Who can stand before His cold?
147.18: He sends out His Word and melts them. He makes His wind blow and the waters flow.
147.19: He speaks His Word to Jacob, and His Law to Israel.
147.20: He has not done this with any other nation. They do not know His Law. Praise the Lord!

148.1: Praise the Lord! Praise the Lord from the heavens! Praise Him on high!
148.2: Praise Him, all His angels! Praise Him, all His army!
148.3: Praise Him, sun and moon! Praise Him, all you shining stars!
148.4: Praise Him, you highest heavens, and you waters above the heavens!
148.5: Let them praise the name of the Lord! For He spoke and they came into being.
148.6: He has made them last forever and ever. He has set a Law which will not pass away.
148.7: Praise the Lord from the earth, you large sea animals and all seas,
148.8: fire and hail, snow and clouds, and wind storms, obeying His Word.
148.9: Praise the Lord, you mountains and all hills, fruit trees and all tall trees,
148.10: wild animals and all cattle, small animals that move on the ground and birds that fly,
148.11: kings of the earth and all people, princes and all leaders of the earth,
148.12: both young men and women who have never had men, and old men and children.
148.13: Let them praise the name of the Lord. For His name alone is honored. His shining-greatness is above earth and heaven.
148.14: He has raised up a horn for His people, praise for all who belong to Him, for the people of Israel, who are near to Him. Praise the Lord!

149.1: Praise the Lord! Sing a new song to the Lord! Praise Him in the meeting of His people.
149.2: Let Israel be glad in his Maker. Let the sons of Zion be full of joy in their King.
149.3: Let them praise His name with dancing. Let them sing praises to Him with timbrels and a harp.
149.4: For the Lord is happy with His people. He saves those who have no pride and makes them beautiful.
149.5: Let those who are God-like be full of joy and honor. Let them sing for joy on their beds.
149.6: Let the high praises of God be in their mouth, and in their hand a sword that cuts both ways.
149.7: Let it be used to punish the nations and the people.
149.8: Let their kings be tied in chains, and their rulers with ropes of iron.
149.9: Let the punishment that is written be given to them. This is an honor for all His faithful ones. Praise the Lord!

150.1: Praise the Lord! Praise God in His holy place! Praise Him in the heavens of His power!
150.2: Praise Him for His great works! Praise Him for all His greatness!
150.3: Praise Him with the sound of a horn. Praise Him with harps.
150.4: Praise Him with timbrels and dancing. Praise Him with strings and horns.
150.5: Praise Him with loud sounds. Praise Him with loud and clear sounds.
150.6: Let everything that has breath praise the Lord. Praise the Lord!
